Title: IT Services Christmas Food Bank Appeal

Description:
During this Covid-19 outbreak, there are more and more people losing their jobs and will need the support of these amazing food banks.

The Trussell Trust work with nutritionists to develop food parcels that contain sufficient nutrition for adults and children, for at least three days of healthy, balanced meals for individuals and families                                                                                                                                                             Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Covid-19 Support the Food Banks

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.

As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: North East Food Bank Network

Description:
We at Stow Park are committed to keeping our food bank open during the current crisis. Our food bank is normally funded by renting rooms at our centre (up to £2000 per month) which is closed following Government instructions. To allow us to continue feeding those in need please give what you can.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Stow Park Community Food Bank

Description:
On 23 May 2020, seven friends - all very much amateur runners - will be covering 100 miles in a day in an effort to raise as much money as we can for the Trussell Trust, who support food banks nationwide. That’s a little over a half marathon each (which will be a first for at least some of us!). 

A disgrace that we have food banks at all in the UK, coronavirus has placed additional pressure on the 14.5 million families (4.5 million children) who already rely on them. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust's network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. 

Please donate whatever you can afford. Even the cost of the coffee you’d usually have bought on your morning commute could help feed a family in this difficult time. #ThisCanChange
Title: 100 miles in a day for food banks

Description:
With Covid-19 taking its toll on jobs across the region, especially in the nightlife and hospitality industry, we wanted to put our networking and marketing channels to good use whilst our events are on pause.

The Trussel Trust operates food bank sites in Newcastle and offers essential emergency food packs to those in need. All money donated via this page will be donated directly to them so they can help the people of our city.

Charity donations are 40% down and it’s likely that The Trussel Trust will see unprecedented demand in the coming weeks as families struggle to get by on statutory sick pay, reduced hours and redundancies so any support you can give the charity would be gladly received. 

It’s a difficult time for everyone so please only give what you can afford. Every little helps.

More information on The Trussel Trust can be found here: https://www.trusselltrust.org/

If you find yourself in financial difficulties and struggling to afford food speak to Citizens Advice. Information relating to food banks can be found here:
https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/benefits/help-if-on-a-low-income/using-a-food-bank/

Thanks, 

Voodoo Events Newcastle.
Title: Voodoo Events Food Bank Appeal

Description:
Here at Carpenters, as part of our corporate social responsibility activity, we have been working with our staff to introduce food collection points in all six of our offices across the UK, including three of our offices based in Merseyside.

Once the donations have come in, we then distribute foodbank items to fans Supporting Foodbanks, a joint initiative between Everton (Est. 1878) and Liverpool (Spirit of Shankly) fan clubs and the Charles Thompson Mission in Birkenhead, just two of the wonderful volunteer organisations in the region who are working hard to supply basic provisions to those in need.

Since we started the initiative in September 2017, we have seen many people want to help but are unsure how so we have set up this page for those who wish to donate but we will also include any donations we might receive.
Title: Carpenters's company food bank page

CharityName: Food Bank For New York City
Description: Natilik are dedicating the next few months to raise money for Food Bank for New York City. During this difficult time the Food bank is taking important steps to ensure that vulnerable New Yorkers who may be quarantined, along with those impacted by the economic downturn, are being supported and provided with emergency food
Title: Natilik's Food Bank for NYC Support

Description:
﻿Horsham Salvation Army is collecting donations to buy food for vulnerable people across Horsham District and the surrounding area who are struggling to provide even the most basic necessities for themselves and/or their families.

The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.
Title: Horsham Salvation Army food bank

Description:
Welcome to our JustGiving page.

Over a month ago, our campaign to stop the draconian practices of HMRC and Concentrix went into overdrive and we succeed in the contract not being renewed.

We have dedicated this last month to helping support families when food banks were at their limit!

As more and more people are getting the money back that they deserve, we thought a great way to give back would be to start a just giving page for the Trussel Trust.

Most of the people affected probably thought they would never need to visit a food bank to feed their families and we know how much they rely on these donations to keep them stocked up.

Please support our fundraising campaign and give what you can! 

Lots of love, the Concentrix Mums Admin Team xxx
Title: Concentrix Mums - Food Bank Drive

Description: Skipton Food Bank gives over 25 tonnes of food a year to people in crisis across Craven. We work by referral through local agencies and feed over 80 people a week. We are a very small charity - part of Skipton Baptist Church - and are run by volunteers, with a part-time paid manager.
Title: Skipton Food Bank Emergency Appeal

Description:
THE FOOD BANK SHOW on PRIMAL LIVING

Every morning at 10am, we will be broadcasting live The Food Bank Show on Youtube providing food and health advice. I will be joined by doctors, medical experts and chefs, many of whom contributed to my latest health book FAT and Furious. Together - we will be taking your questions from around the country and additionally during the shows we will video link to food banks across the UK and discover new ways we can all help offer support. 

With fast food chains closed, we want to seize this opportunity to reshape the eating habits of our nation and improve everyone’s health and whilst we are doing this together -  help feed those most in need during this crisis. Join my family and I , as we put on a truly interactive show and please encourage everyone you care and love to join us too.

We are going live as of Monday 30th of March and continue every single day until at the very least, schools reopen

Right now, our health has never been more important. #TheFoodBankShow 


Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Steve Bennett's The Food Bank Show

Description:
HSDC exists to realise the ambitions of our community - raising aspirations, enabling achievement, fulfilling dreams. By 2025, we will be the first choice FE college for students, staff and employers in Hampshire - fully equipping our communities for work and life. Part of this includes HSDC supporting our communities through this time where Coronavirus is having a hugely negative economic and social impact, preventing many vulnerable people from buying the basic items they need.

HSDC is proud to join forces with London & South East Education Group to support the FE Food Bank Friday initiative.

With more staff and students working and studying remotely and staying home, we have joined this fundraising campaign to support food banks and help ensure they can continue looking after our communities, despite social distancing.

We're raising money for the Trussell Trust, a national charity which supports more than 1,200 food bank centres across the country including several right here in Hampshire..

We are asking our amazing staff and college communities to help us by consider donating what they can to ensure we all can come through this crisis. Together, we are stronger.

Thank you so much for your support. Safe safe and stay well.

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Description:
The staff of Renfrewshire Council, Scotland Excel and the Care Inspectorate are working in partnership with The One Initiative - Making Changes Project through the Food Bank Food Rush Initiative to help support our partner Renfrewshire Food Bank during this busy time presently and in the weeks and months ahead.  

This year is a bit different as we won’t be able to hold our annual office food collection.  However we can still play our part in Making Changes Together.  This page will be available between Monday 29th June - Friday 31st July 2030. The donations will help Renfrewshire Food bank buy the food items that they are low on and to plan for the weeks and months ahead in what is a very busy time for them.    

Last years collection raised 433.95kg which was 1,033 meals for the people of Renfrewshire.  Together we can all help boost last years collection.  All donations received will be to purchase food which will be weighed and outlined in how many meals it will provide.

Title: Tracey's Swishing event to raise funds for food bank

Description:
The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyones lives and turned society upside down.
However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities  in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.
In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone
Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!
Title: Morriston's Morriston Salvation Army Food Bank

Description:
My name is Aimee Ormesher and I am a Liverpool based Personal Trainer who is offering free daily LIVE workouts on social media to raise money for the Trussell Trust Foodbank network, which provides emergency assistance to families and vulnerable people living in food poverty. 

Last year, the trust provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics.  No one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. 

I would like to encourage anyone who is able to make a donation to do so as it will make a big difference to the Trussell Trust’s foodbank networks in Liverpool and Merseyside.

I am truly grateful for your support. xx

Title: Rail Analysis Covid-19 Food Bank Fundraising page

Description:
Trussell Trust supports a nationwide network of food banks and together they provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

At Salesforce we think everyone needs a helping hand some times and with over 5 food banks within a few miles of our London Office all needing help Cloudy Nation ask you:

Please donate the cost of a couple of stable items that Trussell Trust so desperately need: 

Tea Bags - £0.89  / Coffee - £1.89 / UHT Milk - £0.79 / Soup - £0.45

A BIG Thank you 

Trussell Trust - In the UK, more than 14 million people are living in poverty – including 4.5 million children. We support more than 1,200 food bank centres in the UK to provide a minimum of three days’ nutritionally-balanced emergency food to people who have been referred in crisis, as well as support to help people resolve the crises they face. Between April 2018 and March 2019, food banks in our network provided a record 1.6 million food supplies to people in crisis, a 19% increase on the previous year.
Title: The Trussell Trust Food Bank Appeal - Salesforce Cloudy Nation

Description:
The Coronavirus pandemic is affecting the whole world, and with the trend of panic buying perpetuating, the less fortunate in our society cannot feed themselves or their families.

Title: Georgia's Georgia’s Jumble Sale for Food Banks

Description:
Hi I'm Rebecca,  I am doing this because I have seen an increase in demand in food banks within my local community, with food banks seeing an increase in use by 89% compared to the same period last year. During this time there has also been a 107% increase in emergency food parcels for children. 

On the 30th July, my team and I will take the challenge of cycling a distance of 60km to food banks across London, stopping at food banks and delivering the much needed food items. I will be collecting food donations prior to the cycle so if you want to help in providing them do get in touch via bexs.treks@gmail.com.

I pledge to donate 100 cans and £500. This is where I need your help, if you could please donate whatever you can, the money will go directly to the trussell trust. 

The main aim is awareness, if by doing this I can raise the profile of the Trussell Trust food banks and encourage others to donate not just as a one off but regularly that will count as a success. 

Thank you so much!
Title: Bex's treks food bank cycling challenge

Description:
The Oxford Food Bank has been doing an incredible job supporting those in need in the Oxford community during the COVID-19 pandemic, but demand for their services continues to increase.  They need our support now more than ever.

So the University of Oxford's Centre for Socio-Legal Studies is on a mission to get moving, aiming to cover a collective 750 kilometers and raise at least £3000 pounds for the Oxford Food Bank.  

From 1 August to 8 August, our members will be running, hiking, walking, and cycling to reach our 750 kilometer goal:

  • Linda Mulcahy and her dog Ruby will hike 21km.
  • Bettina Lange will run 6km.
  • Ellie Whittingdale will run 20km.
  • Anneloes Hoff will hike and run 100km.
  • Kira Allman will walk and cycle 56km.
  • Ellie Norton will run 58km.
  • Carson Smith will walk and run 30km.
  • Lena Rose will cycle 80km. 
  • Anna Tsalapantis will walk 50km.
  • Victoria McCloud will walk 10km.
  • Colton Wade will run 28km.
  • Chris Decker and his dog Milo will run 25km.
  • Dvora Liberman will walk and cycle 70km.
  • Charmaine Cole will walk and cycle 24km.
  • Kevin Grecksch will swim 5km.
  • Noah Westcombe will walk 12km.
  • Fernanda Pirie will cycle 112km.
  • Matthew, Regina, and Madison Erie will run and walk 18km.
  • Luke Svasti will row 25km.

Charlotte Kelly will also be contributing to our efforts by selling her amazing homemade crafts on Etsy.  You can see her work at: https://www.etsy.com/uk/shop/AsianFabricStashCo.

Please support our team and the Oxford Food Bank by donating here!  Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure.  Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the Food Bank.  

Thank you for making a difference!
Title: CSLS Gets Moving for Oxford Food Bank

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

 The  aim of the Elim Community food bank is to purchase,  collect and distribute commodities  that can enable the preparation  of nutritious and balanced meals for individuals and families. The expense comes at a high  and constant  increasing  cost.

During this 2020 unprecedented lockdown period,  the amount of food collection  increased by 8%. Currently, at Elim church Leytonstone,  ninety eight families are being  served on a weekly basis. https://www.elimleytonstone.org/meet-the-need/

In order to contribute to the purchasing of mostly food items and supplementing the Elim Church Food bank fund, I am preparing to complete a  Sponsored walk.  My activity  at  a tender age  of 70 plus years,  will  include the completion of  three early morning  walks  on the 13th, 15th and 17th July,  at home  covering a total of 12 Km  around a 25 metre garden outline.

You can be involved by giving  your on-line donations  towards sponsoring me  for this challenge. The amount collected  will add to the Church’s Food bank fund. It will also enable an adequate amount of  nutritional food products  to be bought for families.

With thanks for your support.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Title: DOR'S  WALK FOR ELIM COMMUNITY FOOD BANK

Description:
Dear friends and colleagues, 

Welcome to our third annual winter fundraiser! Last year we raised £500 for Jimmy's homeless shelter, so we hope we can top that! This year we are raising funds for the Cambridge City Foodbank again. Winter can be very difficult for those in our communities who are struggling, and the holidays can exacerbate that. The Foodbank is seeded by the Trussell Trust and provides food, sanitary and household supplies, and meter cards for gas and electricity to people in need. 

Food bank use is at an all-time high in the UK and your donations of food and money will go a long way. This winter, help people who are forced to decide to 'heat or eat', and bring some holiday comfort to people in need! Here's how you can help:

1. Donate food. If you are based in the Department of Archaeology, please take part in our food drive. There is a box in the coffee room for supplies and updated shopping lists alongside it.

2. Donate money using this page.

You can get more info about the Cambridge City Food Bank here: https://cambridgecity.foodbank.org.uk/

Thank you for your donations!

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Description:
Every year in Letchworth we knock on peoples doors asking for donations, arrange a summer concert and hold coffee mornings to help raise money for the Big Collection. This year we have not been able to do those things, yet the  demand for our services has increased dur to Covid -19

All donations to the Big Collection directly support The Salvation Army’s work to care for people who are vulnerable or in need. This includes supporting people experiencing homelessness, running care homes and day centres for older people, reuniting families through our Family Tracing Service and providing a place of safety for adult victims of modern slavery.

Through a network of over 650 churches and community centres, we offer compassionate support, a listening ear and practical help to those in need. Our work includes:

  • Supporting men, women and families who are experiencing homelessness
  • Running care homes and day centres for older people
  • Reuniting families through our Family Tracing Service
  • Offering training and advice to people looking for sustained employment
  • Providing a place of safety for adult victims of modern slavery.



The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.
Title: Letchworth Food Bank COVID-19 Response

Description:
Last year, Trussell Trust provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we want to support the food banks that provide a vital service for those who are in crisis. As a nation, no one should be left hungry or destitute but illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Food banks are unfortunately needed throughout the UK even when we aren't facing a global pandemic and now even more during these unprecedented times we must help those who need it. 

Covid-19 is expected to push millions into poverty in the UK and with more facing financial struggles, make it even harder for families to put food on their tables - something we all take for granted. With many not being able to have one decent meal a day during these times of crisis we want to do our bit by raising as much as possible for the Trussell Trust who do amazing work across the UK. 

In order to help, some of the SWW Marketing team will be running 100km each (so 200km in total) over 10 consecutive days starting from Tuesday 14th April and will finish on April 23rd. 

The Trussell Trust support a nationwide network of food banks and together they provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty.

In the UK, more than 14 million people are living in poverty – including 4.5 million children. The Trussell Trust support more than 1,200 food banks in the UK to provide a minimum of three days’ nutritionally-balanced emergency food to people who have been referred to them in crisis, as well as support to help people resolve the crises they face. 

You can find out more about their amazing work here https://www.trusselltrust.org

Please donate anything you can to help the millions who are struggling to eat.
Title: 100k in 10 days for UK food banks

Description:
'Lean On Me' - A performance in aid of The Trussell Trust & Show Racism The Red Card: https://youtu.be/Zo0ozU2ZObw


Please help us support those who are being impacted the most by the COVID-19 pandemic. 

A message from the Trussell Trust

"Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help this can change"

For more information about how The Trussell trust is providing support during the pandemic: https://www.trusselltrust.org/coronavirus-food-banks/
Title: Emergency COVID-19 Food Bank Support

Description:
Where do I even start... the economic impact of the Covid-19 virus has been enormous with many people losing jobs and taking pay cuts. A sad reality for many of the UK’s poorest families is that they genuinely need to rely of food banks to feed themselves or get basic household supplies.  

I feel so sad that this is what some people face while I count myself lucky not to be in this situation. So I feel absolutely compelled to help any way I can.

I’ve decided to set myself a Captain Tom like challenge. I will be running 100km before my next Birthday on June 5th. I plan to run 10km in 10 sessions. I’ll begin on Friday May 22nd and that will give me 14 days to run my 10 x 10km. To put that into perspective that’s the equivalent of over 2 marathons. I tested myself last week running my first 10k and did another one the next day... I was a little sore by day 3. However this is what challenges are all about and I believe in my ability to complete this. 

Please please please... I need some sponsorship money to support my cause. Your donations will go to the Trussell Trust who last year, provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. During this crisis they are also funding UK food banks so that those in need can get much needed help. 

So I pledge to punish myself in the name of charity, your donations will inspire me to rise above the pain I plan to put myself through. To keep me going, and together we can make sure food banks in the UK have the support they need to help those most in need!

I’ll provide running times and updates as I go, let’s do this!
Title: Running for food banks - My 100km Challenge

Description:
We would like to raise £1000 to help those in our local community who are facing extremely difficult times right now.

We have supported the Food Bank at Burnley FC in the Community (part of Burnley Together) for a number of years and have seen first hand the amazing work they do to help those most in need. A spokesperson for the charity told us that they have seen triple the number of people needing help as a direct result of COVID 19 and therefore need all the help they can get.

As you know these are tough times for us all, and for some, everyday life could be made near impossible if it wasn’t for the amazing work of charities like this. So please, donate what you can, spread the word to those around you and support us in our efforts to help those most in need!

Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Description: As we all adapt to self isolation, the number of people on low incomes has increased and donations to food banks are suffering. If like me, you’re struggling to think how to help, let’s put a few pennies together to make sure food banks are well stocked and able to respond to people most in need.
Title: Support Food banks during COVID-19

Description:
Over the month of May, in my local area, I am going to be running the total distance from my house in Stirling to my university flat in Liverpool (248.6 miles).
 While doing this I will be fundraising for UK food banks, so any donations would be great!
I will post updates throughout of how I am getting along.

Below you will find a little bit about the organisation I have chosen to fundraise for.

Save the Mothers Trust (SMT) jointly with Bradford Central Lions Club launched its Food Bank in March 2014 to provide food and support to those less fortunate and in need. The Food Bank is located at the SMT head office in Bradford, West Yorkshire. Since the launch of the Food Bank, it has served many individuals as well as families with young children who are suffering extreme hardships due to cut backs in the benefit system. Some of these people have not eaten for several days and have struggled due to the lack of basic amenities such as heating and electricity. We continuously require items to place in food parcels or cash donations to purchase them. We would appreciate your co-operation in achieving our goal to serve the needy.Donate from as little as £5 per month or £30 to provide one food parcel
Title: Stirling to Liverpool Run- Food Banks UK

Description:
There are lots of things we will miss about rowing this summer: training with our friends; getting an awesome AIO tan; the excitement of racing and representing our college! But there is one tiny bonus, and that is we will save a bit of money through not taking part in races next term. So we have decided as a club, why not do some good with that instead? We would like to encourage our members, if able, to donate the cost of a post training brunch, or a race entry fee, or a celebratory beer, and together we can raise some funds for the Cambridge City Food Bank. 

Last year Cambridge City Food Bank provided 9,243 3- day emergency food supplies to families in crisis across Cambridge. With the current Covid-19 situation, that need is undoubtably only going to increase. For more information on the vital work this group does please visit https://cambridgecity.foodbank.org.uk

Title: St. Hilda's college - Oxford Food Bank

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Claire King For Trussell Trust Food Banks

Description:
I am organising a food drive and fundraiser for the Cambridge City Food Bank. Winter can be very difficult for those in our communities who are struggling, and the holidays can exacerbate that. The Food Bank is seeded by the Trussell Trust and provides food, sanitary and household supplies, and meter cards for gas and electricity to people in need. Food bank use is at an all-time high in the UK and your donations of food and money will go a long way. This winter, help people who are forced to decide to 'heat or eat', and bring some holiday comfort to people in need! Here's how you can help:

1. Donate food. If you are based in the Department of Archaeology, please take part in our food drive. There is a box in the coffee room for supplies and updated shopping lists from the Food Bank alongside it.

2. Donate money, either at the Department reception or using this page.

You can get more info about the Cambridge City Food Bank here: https://cambridgecity.foodbank.org.uk/

Thank you for your donations!

Title: CCPS Raising Money for UK Food Banks

CharityName: THE FOX PROJECT / SOUTHERN WILDLIFE AMBULANCE NETWORK
Description:
I am a local resident - just like you, using the Burgess Park for my daily jogging and walks. I often see beautiful foxes in our Park being chased by the dogs. When the fox pups are born, they are unable to see, hear or walk and are very vulnerable. Many small - baby foxes are at risk of being hurt by the dogs running freely in the park. How would you feel knowing that your dog got in contact with the fox? It’s unsafe not only for the little cubs but also your dog.  Please do keep your dog safe on a leash when possible and help saving the vulnerable, natural live in our Park.

Few weeks ago a small cub was found seriously hurt in our Park. The Fox Project charity was called to help. Now the little cub just like many more small cubs  needs your help to recover and come back to the natural environment.

I am collecting funds to buy food and medication for our cubs. By supporting The Fox Project you give more than just your money - you give a live to many many foxes. 

Next time you see the fox - please do help.

Title: Leon's Baysgarth Trussel Trust Fundraiser

Description:
United World Schools provides aid to poverty-stricken schools in Cambodia, Myanmar and Nepal. The COVID-19 pandemic has brought even greater threat to these communities. The money you donate will go towards 1. Access to safe water and soap, providing the tools they need to prevent viral infection. 2. Home-educational resources to support students whilst schools have temporarily closed. 3. Raising awareness and making sure that the correct information about the nature of the virus reaches these communities (which are otherwise very remote from Governments and NGOs). All donations go towards their emergency COVID-19 response fund.

 10 volunteer tutors from The Bunker Discord have come together to run a week of study streams for anyone to join and ask questions in. The lessons range from medicine to coding, and aimed at high school to sixth form ages, within the UK and internationally!

All Study Streams will be taking place on the server: https://discord.gg/pEzFcgz

Please come along, learn something new, and help support a great cause!

Throughout December will be be raising funds at all our gigs as well as making a contribution ourselves to ensure we can do our bit to stop families in hardship going hungry this Christmas 

Black Country Food Bank helps vulnerable individuals and families in

crisis through the provision of 3 days emergency food supplies while a
longer-term solution is developed. The services we provide have an enormous
impact on the people who use them, giving them an important breathing space at
a time of great need.

Started in June 2006, we are a Christian-based

charitable organisation set up to feed local people experiencing real hardships
by meeting their most basic need for food. Local people, churches and other
organisations in and around the Black Country are joining together to be part
of a project that makes a real difference to the lives of those in crisis.

Title: Tracy's Help Food Banks during Covid-19

Description:
Since the outbreak of COVID-19 across London, food banks have been struggling to cope with the increase in demand. The First Love Foundation Tower Hamlets Food Bank is in desperate need of financial support during this difficult time. Out of the 326 local authorities in England, Tower Hamlets is 99% more deprived than all others with 44% of children living in poverty. Tower Hamlets is only 3 miles away from our office. 

The First Love Foundation will be able to use charitable donations to increase operations in line with the surge in demand, as well as buying food in bulk. They will also be able to offer more services like a door-to-door delivery service for the households that are having to isolate and don't have access to essential food and household goods. 

Thank you for any contribution you are able to make. As a reminder, the firm’s Charitable Foundation will match funds raised by the London office up to a maximum of £10,000.
Title: Sidley's Fundraising for First Love Foundation Tower Hamlets Food Bank

Description:
The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyones lives and turned society upside down.
However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities  in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.
In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone
Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!

"Be the change that you wish to see in the world" 
MK Gandhi

Sewa Day promotes selfless service through local volunteering projects which benefit those around us.   

Thousands of good-hearted people across the world come together to perform Sewa and experience the joy of giving in its truest sense. 

By participating in this collective endeavour, we hope that the seeds of Sewa are watered so that acts of kindness and public service are performed more often. Sewa Day is a catalyst in making this happen.

Description:
The impact Marcus Rashford has made in the last 12 weeks has been incredible, but it’s likely that the government will choose to let children go hungry this summer. 

I never went hungry as a child, but the importance of not wasting food was always drilled into me -everything in sight would be eaten. I filled the goal in the least athletic sense when I played football - a diet of puddings and pies will quickly do that.

It’s clear that many families are struggling to put food on the table during this crisis, so I thought I’d do something to help encourage donations to food banks.

I will potato print you a footballer of your choice and in return, please make a donation to the Trussell Trust, and then send me your address here: https://potatoprinter.com/football-foodbank

The print will be an A6 postcard - I will cover the postage.

Potato printing footballers takes a bit of time, so I am limiting this to 50 postcards on a first come, first served basis. 

Postcards will be posted in an envelope within 7-10 days, via second class post. One postcard, per household. UK only.

Title: Mason's Ride/Scoot/Run for the local food bank

Description:
Food banks are, sadly, a necessity for people up and down the country who struggle to afford food and households items that the vast majority of us take for granted. And with the Covid-19 pandemic putting people out of work and having an unthinkable impact on the economy, for those who struggle the most financially, life just got even harder.

My 40th (on 2 April) is going to be a bit of an odd one and I look forward to celebrating it properly with as many of you as possible later in the year. In the meantime, the best birthday present anyone can give me (to replace the lavish gifts you were, of course, planning) is a donation to The Trussell Trust, who support a nationwide network of food banks, provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK. A bit more info about their work is at the end of this message.

A pint of my fave beer (Beavertown Gamma Ray, as you asked) is about £6.50 (yes yes, welcome to London in 2020) and so I'm asking everyone to donate the price of a pint to The Trussell Trust instead. 

I'd like to raise £400 if poss and I'll get the ball rolling / beer flowing by making a donation myself.

Thank you for your help. Stay safe and see you soon! 

Cx

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Gibbo's 40th Birthday Food Bank Lockdown Bonanza

Description:
Emerge UK is proud to fund-raise on behalf of Trussell Trust.  

Charity Information

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

COVID-19 

It will be no surprise to hear that the coronavirus presents a huge additional pressure to our already overstretched network of food banks, who continue to deal with a record level of need for emergency food. We have already started to see in many of our food banks a reduction in food donations, coupled with a very real shortage of volunteers and on the ground support. We are working closely with our food banks to support them in any way they need, as they face this time of such uncertainty and challenge.  We are focused on rapidly mobilising support so that those most vulnerable to the impacts of poverty and
isolation can survive these months of crisis. As we anticipate a minimum of 400,000 emergency parcels will be supplied over the next three months and we are doing everything we can to establish the infrastructure necessary to enable new food bank delivery models in communities across the UK in response.
Title: Emerge UK COVID-19 Food Bank Appeal

Title: Jason's Shaved his head for Bridgend Food Bank

Description:
For a second year in a row, Warmworks' employees voted by a majority for the Trussell Trust as our annual charity of choice, given their vital work for local Food Banks supporting the most vulnerable communities across Scotland and the UK.

Warmworks would like to help in various ways by starting off with our ‘Virtual 2000-Mile Challenge’. 

Our team aims to achieve this formidable distance collectively from their homes or close-by during lockdown restrictions within one calendar month. This is equivalent to travelling from the most southern (Mull of Galloway) and northern (Skaw, Shetland) points in Scotland and back again – twice! Or nearly 500 miles per week. 

Various members of our team will be setting themselves a daily or weekly distance challenge. Anything goes. From walking, running and cycling, maybe a few PBs, and who knows what other physically challenging indoor or outdoor exploits! Even if it’s just up and down the stairs a few more times every day or walking round the local park. All distances will count – no matter how small. 

Support has never been more vital as food banks report some of their busiest periods ever. Food banks are working incredibly hard to continue to serve their local communities safely despite this unparalleled surge in demand, as well as facing significant challenges as they are forced to change their ways of working. Read more here.

We're proud to be standing alongside the Trussell Trust, food banks, and people in financial crisis. 

Your support will help food banks support people in crisis now and as the situation changes. 

We will be looking to do more activities as the year progresses to meet our funding target. Watch this space. And we want to beat what we raised last year. 

Warmworks and our team of charity fundraisers would be
delighted for any donation you can make – no matter how small. And if your pennies don’t stretch that far. Don’t worry. You can support us on social media by following us on Twitter, Facebook or LinkedIn and help spread the good news. It will motivate us to meet our targets and raise as much vital funding as we can.

Thank you from all of us!
Title: Warmworks Fundraising Challenges for the Trussell Trust & Food Banks

Description:
During the pandemic, I've been making reusable, washable fabric face-coverings/masks for family and friends. I'm very happy to make you some too in return for a donation to the Trussel Trust!

Suggested donation: £7 for one mask, £12 for two, £15 for three or £20 for four.

Please email j.c.a.read@googlemail.com, subject line "masks", with details of how many you want, in which sizes (large, medium, small), and an address for me to post or deliver them to.

[I may take this page offline if demand looks to be higher than I can keep up with!]
Title: Handmade reusable fabric face-coverings -- for food banks!

Description:
Food bank usage has soared during the COVID-19 pandemic. The Trussell Trust, the UK’s largest food bank network, states: 

“During April 2020, food banks in our network saw a 89% increase in need compared to the same period last year, with a staggering 107% increase in emergency food parcels for children.”

Although lockdown has brought significant financial hardship, many students have found they are spending less than they would normally. We are asking those in a position to do so to consider donating the money that they might otherwise spend on a meal out or a formal to the Trussell Trust to support local food banks, in order to help some of those hardest hit by this crisis.

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us.
Title: Meals Out Money for Trussel Trust Food Banks

Description:
Hello lovely people,

During these testing and troubling times I think it's more important than ever to look for the positives and what we can do to make a difference. After much deliberation (I have lovely hair!) I have decided to shave my head on 30/3/2020 for charity.

Having spoken to my local food bank they have informed me that donations of essential items are decreasing already, and only expect this to get worse as the pandemic continues and/if more measures are put in place. Over 500 people a month use this service already, with this only likely to increase due to the economic hardships COVID-19 is likely to bring. 

With the supermarkets already practically empty its not hard to imagine the devastating impact this could have.

Any money raised here will be going directly to Harlow Foodbank (Co-ordinated by the Michael Roberts Charitable Trust) to help with running costs, such as logistics and warehousing costs, as well as purchase of essential items (tinned foods, toiletries, fruit juice etc.) which are already at critically low levels.

With everything that is going on at the moment I understand how difficult it may be to donate. As a self-employed DJ, I myself have no work for the foreseeable future, however even a donation of £1 could make a difference. 

Now more than ever its important to look out for people in need.

Thanks for taking the time to read this.

Lash x

Title: Zoes 312 km  solo cycle for uk food banks

Description:
Please help us raise as much as possible for an excellent cause!

In the London Borough of Tower Hamlets, 48.6% of children live in poverty, and one fifth of households have an annual income of less than £15,000. As winter closes in and bills for heating rise, Christmas can become a time of upset and anxiety.

Since 2012, First Love Foundation have run a Christmas Hamper Appeal – a community effort to enable families and individuals in Tower Hamlets to enjoy the festive season together. Every year, with the help of organisations and local people across the borough, we have put together hundreds of special festive food hampers, as well as toys for children, and gifts for parents. We have also invited families to join us for a Christmas celebration, to receive these gifts and have festive fun together.

Last year, they supported over 450 people through the appeal – none of which would have been possible without donations from hundreds of individuals and organisations like you.

This year, Love at Christmas aims to be bigger than ever before and reach more people who are facing crisis. At this event there will be a Christmas lunch, entertainment and gifts for all the families, couples and single people invited. We will also be delivering food hampers and gifts to young people across the borough who are resident in hostels and might otherwise be isolated from friends and families.

All money raised will go directly to the charity to allow them to distribute hampers to those who need it most, from those who attend the Tower Hamlets Food bank to isolated residents in local youth hostels.

If you wish to give offline there are collections buckets located in 5NC and 1CP. We are also looking for new toys and toiletries and there will be a drop-off point in 5NC - please contact Matthew Farrell, Tonyia Ramsook, Julian Sampson and/or Tom McConnell for further detail. 

If you would like any more information please contact Amy Ertan, Natalie Plant or Daniela Pinardi.

Title: Paul's CAN Comedy - Black Country Food Bank Fundraiser

Description:
During lockdown, we completed the Girlguiding ‘Take Action - Make Change’ Skills Builder all about community action. Our final task was to develop a ‘pack’ of items that could be given to someone in need.

During our discussion we felt that because of the Covid-19 pandemic many families would be impacted by job losses or being furloughed that they may not be able to buy food and essentials and might need the services of a food bank. We researched food banks and discovered that last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust network alone provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children.

With a budget of £5 we made a theoretical pack of supplies containing essential food items such as pasta, milk, oats, tinned vegetables and soups as well has household items such as detergent, shampoo and sanitary products. Adding in some treats such as lemonade and biscuits we were pleased with how far £5 could stretch. We felt inspired by our Skills Builder that we wanted to convert this into something real.

So, if you’re still reading this far, we are challenging ourselves to each run 50km or cycle 75km in total over the months of July & August to raise money for the Trussell Trust, which has food banks all over the UK including in Woolwich and Plumstead where we live, and in normal times meet at Rangers. 

Please consider sponsoring us for this physical challenge for a great cause. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help more families. Our aim is for the equivalent of 10 of our £5 packs but of course we would be super excited if we raised even more for the Trust to help families in need during this pandemic.

Many thanks

Sheddweller Rangers, Woolwich District, London South East Girlguiding.
Title: Sheddweller Rangers - Run & Cycle for Trussell Trust Food bank

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I am on day two of quarantine, and the government has released its new guidance on social distancing, restrictions on public life and advice on avoiding infection.

I am already missing patisserie, proper coffees, and posh tea in lovely little cafes.  Now, obviously, I am well aware that this is the absolute definition of a spoiled cow problem.  There are millions of people who never had that option.  And now, they are struggling for pasta, for rice, for the basics of feeding their families, more than ever.  People using food banks can't stockpile.  They can't pay inflated prices, might not even have the bank account you need for online delivery, let alone be able to afford the fees.  People will suffer when they have to pull their children out of school and the free hot lunch isn't provided to their home.  This is going to be very bad for far too many people.

The Trussell Trust is the largest food bank charity in the UK.

Every time I desperately, desperately want a proper coffee and a little cake, I will donate the money here instead.  I would be delighted if you felt able to do the same.  

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. Title: Basildon Salvation Army Covid 19 response

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

 These are very uncertain trying times, and I know there are plenty of people out there who currently rely on the fantastic service their local food banks have to offer. Why am I doing this? Well, I've seen similar things happening elsewhere and whilst trying to find ways to help out locally I figured that sticking to what I am good at would be the best way to go. I enjoy photography, it’s a passion of  mine. I’m also what you’d call a social butterfly, so the two tend to go hand in hand.

During the current lockdown situation and the governments advice on social distancing I wanted to somehow document this on my one walk of the day, but also being productive. I'd like the opportunity to photograph you and your family from a safe distance, on your doorstep, pulling stupid faces at the windows, maybe doing cartwheels in the garden, what ever you're up for. And for just £5 you get a couple of photos to remind you of a time you're unlikely to ever forget and the Mid Cheshire Foodbank gets 100% of that fee. This isn't about work, more about keeping active and helping out. Thank you so much for your support and I hope to see you on my rounds. Much love to you all, Adam xx
Title: Weaverham residents photo shoot walk for mid Cheshire food bank

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

My name is Joan, I am in my 60`s and live on a farm near Chiddingfold. During early lock-down I took my daily exercise checking the sheep and walking through our woods but this very soon extended to a regular six mile round trip to the supermarkets of Haslemere. This was not unlike my early childhood in Fisher Lane as my parents had no car and our shopping was in either Chiddingfold, Plaistow or Dunsfold and was always done on foot.

My faith is important to me and the idea of a journey where the difficulties of each day were supported by a verse or passage prompted me to sign up for a Virtual  Camino de Santiago pilgrimage in Northern Spain.

After a few weeks of building up my daily miles I officially commenced my 480 mile journey on the 4th July when Rotary opened up their community PEP pop up shop in West St Haslemere. 

Since then I have tried to walk about 12 - 15 miles a day for six days a week, with every walk having some significance or purpose. This has included a cross country walk to Farnham to visit my daughter and a circuit of my childhood shopping walks with Mum. Most days will include some special place or space for reflection and every day is logged and ticked off my virtual challenge .Unfortunately I will now have to plan an extra walking trip to the Chiropodist as after two weeks and nearly 200 miles my walking boots and toes are starting to disagree.

I have a number of friends and acquaintances who have been seriously impacted  physically, emotionally and financially by Corona virus and I felt compelled to support the local community in some way. This year, Haslemere Rotary are fundraising for the local Food Banks and also Haslemere Stroke Club so were the ideal focus for my fundraising efforts.

Please help me support the work of these vital local charities.

Thankyou 

Joan Mills
Title: Joan's 480 mile walk for Haslemere Food Bank and Stroke Club

Title: Citi UK COVID-19 Response: Northern Irish Food Banks

Description:
We’re shut in and fed up, but at least we’ve got chicken goujons and Cornettos. This whole pandemic nonsense will hit those on low to no incomes the hardest and, right now, it’s tricky enough to find some of life’s essentials in the shops when you can afford them.

So as I sat here at home, unravelling at the prospect of being on lockdown, stuck inside, having to move house and have building work done in the midst of all of this, I realised I was being a bit of a whiny bitch. So, in a not entirely selfless effort to take back some control and maybe put a Kit-kat in a hungry mouth, I’ve decided to buzz off my hair for charity.

Specifically, The Trussell Trust, who support a nationwide network of food banks, including one in Cheltenham. Coronavirus has made food banks even more necessary for some people, so I thought they were a good recipient of the hair money. It’s like blood money but scratchier. 

I’ve never buzzed my hair off before, and I’m fairly sure I’ll look ridiculous, so there’s your incentive. I’ll live stream the removal of my distinguished locks and may well get my daughter to do the deed as she’ll no doubt find it hilarious and will be able to reach the back better.

Target’s £500. More would be amazing though, and super helpful for a really important charity. I dunno, maybe I’ll dream up some stretch goal rewards or something if we break the target. Time and date of The Buzzening to be announced as and when/if the mark is hit. If it isn’t hit, well, we’ll see. And I say buzz rather than shave because I’m not pulling a razor across my bonce. I don’t want a shiny head.

Title: FOOD BANK/ St.Catherines church repair (window after recent damages)

Description:
Why do we want to help?

We chose to support “The Trussell Trust Food Bank” because it is close to Huy and Virginia’s house and as Virginia and Cristina have had a good experience supporting this kind of charity in the past. Huy has never fundraised for a charity and he thinks that a food bank is a good way to start.

Our Idea is write typical recipes from our countries of origin. We will prepare a script where we are going to explaining the dish. We will put a description of the ingredients and then we will explain the preparation of the dish step by step.

Specific objectives

•    Improve our knowledge about charities and ways of taking part in a charity as a volunteer.

•    Learn vocabulary about charities.

•    Learning how we can use correctly this vocabulary about voluntary and charity.

•    We will encourage more people to participate in a charity.

Why do we want to help?

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Recipes

Spanish omelette

First, collect all the ingredients that you are going to need:

  • 1kg of potatoes
  • 8 eggs
  • 1 onion
  • Salt
  • Oil

Then, heat the oil in the pan while cutting the onion. When the oil is ready, put the onion in the pan over medium heat. To continue, peel and cut the potatoes in slices of approximately 3mm, and place the potatoes in the pan too.

The perfect point for the potatoes is between cooked and fried.  This process needs between 10-15 minutes and while the potatoes are cooking you can beat the eggs.

When the potatoes are ready, drain them very well from the oil, mix them with the eggs and stir well again. Let the mixture rest for 5 minutes. You will know that you have enough egg if it covers the potatoes.

Once everything is mixed, put a little oil in a new pan and make sure that all the pan is covered by the oil. Then put all the mixture in the pan to simmer. To know when it is ready, try with a fork. If the mixture is getting hard, turn the omelette using a dish. Now put the omelette in the pan again at maximum heat for one minute, and it is ready!

I hope you like it!

Colombian Arepas

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup milk
  • 1 egg
  • 1 cup pre-cooked corn meal (such as P.A.N.®)
  • 1 cup grated cheddar cheese or mozzarella
  • 1 tablespoon butter
  • 5 tablespoon sugar
  • ½ teaspoon salt

Materials:

  • Big bowl.
  • A fork
  • Plastic bag
  • A pan
  • A spatula

Preparation:

On a bowl, you will mix milk, sugar, salt, egg, cheese and corn.  If you want, you can use your hands to Knead or use a fork. Mix the mass until that it has a soft consistency. Make balls of the size your hand.

Put into the plastic bag each ball and crush them with your hands or with a plate. You decide the thick that you want for “arepas”.

Add “arepas” with a little butter into the pan until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side.
Turn each “arepa” with the aid of spatula.

 Enjoyment!

Title: I am raising money for food banks who are experiencing a food shortage.

Description:
Rotherham (Kimberworth) Salvation Army is one of the few food banks in the Rotherham "Food in Crisis" Partnership that has been able to keep operating from day 1 of the Covid-19 pandemic lockdown. Our partnership is co-ordinated by Voluntary Action Rotherham, and supported by Yorkshire Fareshare. 

Our operation consists of just two people, yet we have been able to source, prepare and deliver over 100 food parcels direct to the door of families in need. There are many more families on our waiting list, but we are struggling to keep pace with the growing levels of need, as our stock of food and household supplies is constantly being exhausted in these extremely challenging times. 

Despite fantastic support from Fareshare and local supermarkets, including Morrisons and Aldi, the supply of donated food is simply not able to meet the demand as we seek to support the practical needs of individuals and families in the Rotherham area, across a wide spectrum of people, ranging from some of the most vulnerable members of our community, to those who are self-isolating, as well as hard-working families who have seen their livelihoods evaporate overnight.

Consequently, we are now having to resort to queuing up at the local supermarket several times a week in order to purchase additional food and household supplies, just to keep up with the demand.

Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!
Title: Rotherham Salvation Army COVID-19 Crisis Response - Food Bank Fund

Title: 1000km Challenge

Description:
For the past three years FAST UK has helped to finance an emergency food bank for some of the poorest people and families living in the Rroma village called Apalina on the outskirts of Reghin. So far the charity has helped to feed over 200 families but we would love to help more!

After a past visit we were asked for some help by Pastor Attila Toth who informed us that many families within this village were trying to survive on just one or two small meals per week. In the summer months it is possible for families to survive on gleanings from locally grown crops but in winter with temperatures often dropping to as low as -32 degrees centigrade with snow on the floor this makes this way of living almost impossible.

With the money raised on this page as a charity we will send money to Attila so that he is able to purchase good basic food locally in Reghin. All of the food purchased will be given out to the most needy families according to the need. 

On a recent visit this summer that I was on Attila told one of our trustees that the funds provided over the past few years have enabled people to have enough to eat through the harsh winters and in a few cases even prevent people from starving to death. After seeing the people living within the village in September 2017 and hearing many families stories, I feel very passionate about helping them and would love you to as well!

Currently the total we send to the food bank is £1500.00 per year but we would love to send more if possible so more people can be helped. The £1500.00 we give feeds approx 200 through the long winters which amounts to about £10 per person to see them through the whole winter period. This money not only enables people to eat but also to have a much easier time throughout the winter months as this is often the hardest time for families living in such a difficult environment and with so little. 

Can you help some on eat well this winter for just £10?

If you can help then that would be fantastic, remember no matter how much you can donate, every pound helps to feed a person for a day, week, month and winter.

Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Feed a person for just 10 pounds through the Apalina Food Bank with FAST UK

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

AN ABSOLUTE MUST HAVE FOR ANY PATRIOTIC SCOTTISH DOG!

OK, fair enough. This is a bit nuts. A lot nuts actually. See the picture of the blue football shirt? Well, it ain't just any football shirt. It is a Scotland shirt for the discerning, patriotic smaller Scottish dog. Believe it or not we have had forty of these donated and they are all in serious need of a good home.

Well in a few days time Scotland will be taking on the Auld Enemy at Wembley and your wee pooch must be desperate to wear the colours. So here's the good news. If you were to give any kind of donation to this page one of these canine shirts might just find its way to you in the post so long as you give me a bell on 077770 443483 to sort it out.

Yeah, I know. But these are times when frontline charities like First Base need to clutch at every straw we can find!

ABOUT ME LIVING OFF ONE OF OUR FOOD PARCELS.

I really don't want to make any kind of big deal out of what I'm doing here! I guess in a way I am about to put my money where my mouth is. In September I will live off one of the First Base Agency's emergency food parcels for half a week. 

Check out the picture above. I know. It isn't going to be so very hard, right?. And it shouldn't be so very hard. All of us at First Base are pretty proud of the emergency food parcels we have been handing out for the last 13 years. We are very much aware that the REALLY hard part of living off emergency food is being in a position where you NEED to live off emergency food. It is a very bleak place indeed to find yourself in. We see this every single day in the eyes of those who come into First Base.

I am lucky. I don't need emergency food. Not right now at least. So I am not asking for your support for any kind of recognition of me doing something remotely difficult. Instead I am asking for support for something much more profound. Over the coming eight months of winter over 3000 people will come through the doors of First Base. Each and every one of them will be in the miserable position of finding themselves unable to buy food to eat. And we will all do our very best to make sure each and every person who comes to us will leave the building with a bag full of the kind of food I am about to live off for a few days.

But there is a problem. A pretty big problem. As I write these words we have enough funding in place to just about keep the doors open until the end of December. Then nothing. January nothing. February nothing. March nothing. Three long, cold winter months when hundreds and hundreds of people will need us to be there to provide emergency food.

Sadly this is a problem we are only too familiar with. Every frontline charity in Britain knows how it is to live on the edge of a funding cliff. It is hard and it is stressful. Our local community is utterly amazing when it comes to donating food. Last year we received over £40,000's worth. When I spend my three days eating emergency food I will be lucky enough to have a fresh loaf of bread donated by Greggs and a pack of ham donated by Brown Brothers. The list of our food donors is a long one and we feel honoured to be supported by so many.

However the bags of food that arrive every day will never pay our electric bill. Or the phone bill. Or the rent. Or wages. Or the detailed accounts we are legally and rightly obliged to produce for the charity regulator. Or fuel in the tank to deliver made up food parcels to the 20 collection points we bow have across the region.

These are the boring bills which cover the nuts and bolts of keeping the doors of any front line charity open. They are boring but unavoidable. And the money to cover these boring bills is our life blood. By hook or by crook we need to find £20,000 before the end of March to ensure our doors stay open. It won't be easy. Anything but. However it is a situation we are only too familiar with. We have faced down this kind of funding crisis many times over the last 13 years and we are confident of doing so again. Never once have we turned away a single person who has come to us for emergency food. Not once. We're all pretty proud of that record and we have no intention of allowing such a thing to happen in the coming winter.

So. How can you help? Well there are two options. Of course you can donate a few quid on this page and if you do so we will be hugely appreciative. Or maybe you might want to go a stage further and do exactly what I am doing - live off a First Base emergency food parcel for half a week and raise so cash either with a page like this one or by using more traditional sponsorship forms. So how would that work? Easy. You can call me on either 07770 443483 or 01387 279680 or you can e mail me at markglenmill@aol.com. I will then deliver you a three day food parcel and sponsorship forms should you need any. Tell you what. I'll throw in a full signed set of my back list of books as a thank you. Then it is a case of eating emergency food for three days and chasing in a few donations. 

So that's that I guess. Please support us either by donating to this page or by starting up a page of your own. Maybe I will see you soon with a box of food and a bag of books!

All the best

Mark
Title: I'm raising cash to make sure the First Base food bank survives the winter

This shouldn't be happening in 2020.Hunger isn‘t  just about food. It’s about not having enough money for the essentials. No one should be forced to use a food bank to get by. Lets see a UK without the need for food banks, where everyone has enough money to afford the basics and put a stop to poverty.

Description:
Thank you for arriving here for a read!

Last year I booked with Global Adventure Challenges to climb Ben Nevis in June 2019. In September 2018 I started losing weight to get myself fit for the challenge (starting weight 299 lbs - goal weight 199 lbs) and am starting the year having already nearly lost 1/2 the weight. 

On this first day of New Year 2019 training starts. While I shift the final 58 lbs to get to my goal to do the challenge, I also have to get myself fit enough to do it. This will involve many months of long walks and steep hills as well as getting my legs stronger in the gym to be able to climb the tallest mountain in the UK. 

BUT this is not only a personal challenge, I really want to help The Trussell Trust food banks here in South Yorkshire. People poverty that leads to food poverty is something that shouldn't be happening in our society. Our children shouldn't be going hungry. 

While we all have to take responsibility for our spending and make sensible choices to look after our loved ones, there are still many people who really struggle to support themselves and their families and reach a crisis point. We need to be helping these people, ensuring we can help support with food and essentials during these critical times.

Please donate to my JustGiving page. I will also be asking my work if we can collect food bank items to bring to The local Trussell Trust food bank in Rotherham on a monthly basis.

Thank you for your support

C xxxxxx

Now you can do your bit to support this wonderful organisation and it will only take a few seconds. Text 'TOFB99 £10' to 70070 and help us hit our £1,000 target for text donations!

Title: Hania's 2.6 challenge

Description:
In Short

We are five students at St. Edwards Oxford and our goal is to live off of £1.50 each day for three days in order to a) raise awareness for just how difficult it is to live below the poverty line and b) to raise money for the Oxford Food Bank. We intend to raise £500 pounds and we appreciate any donations big or small.

Thank you in advance from Clare, Jackson, Zak, Will and Natalia  :-)

Some Things To Keep In Mind...

  • . "In October 2015, the World Bank updated the international poverty line to $1.90 (£1.50) a day. The new figure of $1.90 is based on ICP purchasing power parity (PPP) calculations and represents the international equivalent of what $1.90 ((£1.50) could buy in the US in 2011." - Wikipedia
  •  An estimated 1.4 billion people worldwide face this exact challenge daily.

So What does £1.50 Include?

Well Our aim is that our 1.50 budget for each day will include all main meals and any needs other than water. This includes any form of food, toiletries (e.g toothpaste, body wash, soap, toilet paper ) and any other things that we may need to buy during the course of the next three days! Of course most of our budgets will be geared towards food so we will have to drop much of the so called necessities that we consume in our normal lifestyles!

Meal Diary

Day 1: 

Breakfast = --nuthin--

Lunch = Oven baked chips, rice, Fried egg and baked beans.

Dinner = Oven baked chips, Egg Fried Rice (or an attempt at it...)                                      and baked beans

Check Our Gallery And Update Feed For More! Or Follow Us On Instagram at @livingatthepovertyline

Description:
After four years at Rice, you may not have always loved Houston. But like me, you probably have some space in your heart for it, in all its sprawling, diverse, concrete, cultural, foodie glory. And it's heartbreaking to watch it flood; to watch families flee their homes, to watch so many lose so much. As a former (or current) part of the Houston community, we thought it would be good to give a space for Rice alumni (and friends) to help keep #HoustonStrong. 

The Houston Food Bank is a part of the local community, meaning that your donation will reach those in need more quickly. It comes highly vetted by Charity Navigator (four stars) and is recommended by Houston natives. Your support will help local residents in the weeks and months to come, as they begin the long process of pulling their lives together after devastating losses. If the food bank is not your thing, please donate to another great local organisation, from diaper banks to the Montrose Center, Baker Ripley, or local animal shelters, who could use your support. 

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. They do take a small fee - 5% - but I am looking into ways of having this cost covered by a matched donation to the organisation. 

I may have been overly ambitious in my target, but I know my fellow Owls are generous (and like 27% of you are lawyers, so)

*makes weird owl symbol with fingers that only you guys get*,

Caroline Glendenning-Platt, Hanszen '04
Title: Owls for Houston

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Blackpool Symphony Orchestra has been playing for you since 1921. As we can't meet to rehearse at the moment because of the Coronavirus we are doing a virtual performance of Somewhere Over the Rainbow and mindful of the challenges the lockdown poses for many people wanted to use the opportunity to raise money for our community. 

If you are able to support us by making a donation, however small, to Blackpool Food Bank we would really appreciate it.

We hope you enjoy the music too.

The music has been especially arranged for us by local composer, Edward Rugman, our Composer in Residence and in addition to our virtual performance we will also  be performing the piece live in one of centenary concerts next season.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to Blackpool Food Bank. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Blackpool Symphony Orchestra Somewhere Over the Rainbow

Description:
Watch our video-  https://youtu.be/l1p1r7msvkY

Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

The Young Theatre Company desperately wants to support those around us who are facing one of the greatest challenges of their lives. Many families, friends and neighbours are out of work and struggling to provide for themselves and those they love.

Our specially arranged version of "When A Rainbow Fills The Sky" has been beautifully sung & signed in Makaton Sign Language by 66 YTC pupils & families aged 4- 54! The video has been made to raise money for the Bassetlaw Food Bank who provide vulnerable people with the food they need to survive during the Coronavirus outbreak and beyond. We hope you enjoy our special performance, and it would be wonderful if you could help us to help others.

We love singing, dancing and acting at The Young Theatre Company and desperately miss our theatre friends. However, you can't stop us performing!  If our singing and signing has made you smile, then please consider donating whatever you can. Every penny counts!

"After the storm comes the rainbow. The greater your storm, the brighter your rainbow."

Thank you
