Description:
Friends,

Thank you for taking the time to visit my fundraising page for Urban Community Projects, a charity which provides an array of activities - food deliveries, job training, mentoring, financial coaching - to members of our community who are most in need. I recently signed up to volunteer for one of Urban Community Projects' initiatives, the Camden Mobile Food Bank, to deliver food donations to vulnerable families who live on local estates. I signed up for the initiative because of 2 major reasons:

1) More so than ever, this is a time when the recipients really need our help as many of them, be it the elderly or ill, are confined to their homes and are unable to collect the food parcels themselves.  

2) I myself have been fortunate enough to be a recipient of other people's generosity of time and financial resources, and I know from firsthand experience that a small act of kindness has the power to make a significant difference to another individual's life. To the extent that I am able to, I would like to keep this 'cycle of generosity' alive.

I am appealing to you because alongside my volunteering to deliver food, I have created a page to help raise funds for Urban Community Projects so that the charity is able to continue carrying out essential services to vulnerable members of our community, at a time when it is most needed. If you are able to, I ask that you please donate through the Just Giving  website to support Urban Community Projects.

I will match your donations by committing to doing as many food delivery trips as I can possibly squeeze in outside of my work hours.  

Thank you in advance.
Sello
Title: A Helping Hand

Description:
The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyone's lives and turned society upside down. However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines. In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone. Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!

Leicester Salvation Army is collecting donations to buy food for vulnerable people in our community who are struggling during the coronavirus pandemic. £5 can provide a box of essentials for a family of 4.
Title: The Salvation Army Leicester South

Description:
K-Rich Records is teaming up with Brixton Brewery, our official sponsor for the brand new segment, to bring you a live stream virtual concert series uplifting UK musicians and artists to raise funds for the Trussell Trust and provide you guys with some entertainment during the ongoing lockdown. The Trussell Trust does amazing work across foodbanks throughout the UK, and are providing much needed Covid-19 relief during this crazy time. We have an insanely talented line-up ready for you for this great cause so please donate and share around to your friends and family. 

Our goal is to raise £1000 - this is a chance not only to support London creatives, but also two local businesses and those in need during this crazy time.

The Trussell Trust's aim is to end hunger and poverty in the UK. They
support a nationwide network of food banks and
together provide emergency food and support to
people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to
end the need for food banks in the UK.

You can catch the latest episodes of the series on our YouTube channel @KRichRecords
Title: K-Rich Records' Q Live Sessions Fundraising Series

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I started jogging up and down the garden at the start of lockdown before venturing out onto the streets and running to neighbouring villages. A colleague inspired me to run my first virtual run, which entailed running the length of the 245-mile NYC Subway for disadvantaged communities affected by COVID. The lockdown made me appreciate how fortunate I am, and how some lives were being devastated by the terrible virus. I have enough to live on, others do not. Poverty is increasing all the time and people are finding it harder and harder to find enough to live on. Food banks play a vital role in helping struggling families during the lockdown, and I  want to help them by raising funds through my daily exercise routine.

Description:
Emma and Harry have been inspired by the story of Captain Tom Moore and wanted to do something to help those around them. They came up with the idea of cycling 200 miles over the next month. This will be a big challenge for little children with little legs, but they are determined and enthusiastic about supporting the Romsey Food Bank  

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year. Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Emma and Harry - the big bike challenge

Title: My bday

Description:
We exist to ensure that no one in Waterloo goes hungry.

For people on low incomes, a sudden crisis  redundancy, benefit delay, illness or even an unexpected bill  can mean going hungry. Every day parents skip meals to feed their children and people are forced to choose between paying the rent or eating.

Since our launch weve given away over 100 tonnes of food to over 12,500 people in need, including almost 5,000 local children.

We are part of The Trussell Trusts UK-wide foodbank network, and together we provide food to thousands of people nationwide every year. The Foodbank is hosted at the Oasis Centre, St Johns Waterloo and St George the Martyr on behalf of South Bank Churches.

We work with local frontline care professionals, such as schools, charities, housing associations, GPs, health visitors and churches, to identify those in need. They distribute vouchers that the client then exchanges for food. When clients arrive at the Foodbank, we offer them the chance to meet with
Title: Waterloo Foodbank

Description:
This year has brought uncertainty to many people's daily lives across the UK and in April food banks saw an 89% increase in need and 107% increase in food parcels for children compared to last year. 

Those on furlough at IPS Group wanted to do something to help food banks and the people accessing them across the UK. Together with the wider IPS team we have set a challenge for us to "Tour" (virtually) all UK offices from London during a 4 week period. Along the 230 mile route we shall pass Birmingham, Manchester and Leeds. 

We will be tracking most of the progress via Strava and will be walking, running or cycling the route. 

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Description:
I've never really run properly until the lockdown, so I thought let's give this a good go...

Together with my dad Robert Pickles, we both decided to run a half marathon each on the 8th of June to raise money for those who are suffering acutely from the Covid-19 crisis with the scarcity of income and therefore the basics of food which we all take for granted. 

We will suffer the miles as long as someone gets food to eat for every mile we run!

So please give as much as you can for a very worthy cause.
Title: Pickles run for Food

Description:
KASH are Kelly Anne Sharp & Simon Halliday, a duo who create moving and uplifting music. We have four recorded songs to date, and three more in the making.

We are releasing our song on VE Day 2020 in anticipation of a ‘VC Day’ – Victory Over Covid.

The song is called 'Rise Above' and we are making it freely available as a way to help raise awareness of immediate human needs by supporting The Trussell Trust.

The Trussell Trust provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis last year. More than half a million of these went to children.

You can donate here and watch our video at
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=szV8dw6D5jQ

Feel free to share this video on YouTube and on social media to aid our charity effort, ensuring you include links back to the JustGiving donation page.

The song ‘Rise Above’ © 2012 was written and recorded by Kelly Anne Sharp and Simon Halliday and the copyright remains with them, all rights reserved.

If you would like a higher quality recording for use on radio, television or another channel, then please contact us directly at kashforcharity@gmail.com, through YouTube or other social media.

Thank You!

Released 8th May 2020 (Recorded 2012)
Voice: Kelly Anne Sharp, Piano: Simon Halliday, Strings: Richard Curran, Video Editing: Jason Hancox, Photos: Kelly Anne Sharp, Simon Halliday & friends, Rainbow Picture: ‘Erynn’s Rainbow’ by Erynn, Studio: Alan Gregson, West Orange Studio, Preston. ‘Rise Above' song © Kelly Anne Sharp & Simon Halliday 2020 All Rights Reserved.
Title: Kelly Anne Sharp & Simon Halliday's KASH for Covid - Rise Above

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

A couple of years ago, I was lucky enough to have the members of the Australian metal band Ne Obliviscaris to sign an electro-acoustic violin we used for the violin player with my own band. I had a plan to start collecting a large number of memorabilia to do a big charity campaign & raffle.

Unfortunately, Time/Life got in the way a bit, so the collection wasn't quite as large as I would have liked. A few items have gone 100% sale price to charity on ebay already, and about £250 has been raised so far.

The violin, however, will be Raffled as opposed to auctioned, because I believe it is far more likely to sell 100 tickets @ £5 each than one person willing to spend £500 at auction

Terms & conditions - by donating / entering the raffle, you confirm you agree to the following:

1 - All donations of multiples of £5 will count as 1 raffle ticket. (e.g. £25 donation = 5 tickets).

2 - You MUST tick the box to "share your information" in order to enter - without donor details, I have no way of contacting them to arrange the delivery.

3 - I will print off the raffle tickets and live stream the cutting, folding, entering into a bag and drawing a winner, for complete transparency.

4 - The winner will be notified by email & on Facebook. I will pay for INTERNATIONAL shipping myself. If the winner does not respond within 14 days to the contact attempts, a new Winner will be drawn,

5 - The Winner will receive the violin. However, should they wish to part with the violin, they do NOT have authorisation to sell it for a Profit. Should they wish to auction / raffle for Charity, that is OK, however if they attempt to sell the violin for a personal profit / trade (etc) or accept any goods, services or personal renumeration for the Violin, then I reserve the right to request it's return. a refund of the raffle price (£5) will be offered in such circumstances, which I will pay myself.

6 - The violin is being raffled as musical memorabilia, not as a musical instrument. Although it is playable, and the electrinics do work.
Title: Oliver's Trussell Trust raffle - violin signed by Ne Obliviscaris

Description:

Title: Kate's Birthday

Description:
The Trussell Trust is helping to support food banks across the UK (73 in London), as well as providing emergency food to those most in need during the Coronavirus crisis. Food banks are experiencing a huge increase in demand as more vulnerable people turn to them for help through COVID-19. 

“Food banks face an unprecedented challenge in the coming months. As the coronavirus outbreak unfolds, more people are likely to need emergency food at exactly the same time as fewer volunteers are able to help. The resilience of food banks is nothing short of outstanding, and we’re working closely with our network to help ensure that wherever possible, people unable to afford the essentials can access help. But this is not easy."

Hines in London will be fundraising to support the Trussell Trust continue their essential work with societies most vulnerable during this difficult time. 

We appreciate your support. 

oneHines - London Local Ambassadors
Title: oneHines's London COVID-19 Fundraiser

Description:
Since current Government advice means I won't be seeing anyone anytime soon, I thought I'd do something drastic and shave my head for charity!

This is a tough time for all but the people my parents and Stow Park support have nothing. They rely on the food bank to support their families and survive on a daily basis.

The Centre is committed to keeping the food bank open during the current crisis. It is normally funded by renting rooms at the centre (up to £2000 per month) which is closed following Government instructions. To allow them to continue feeding those in need please give what you can.

Description:
To raise money for United Welsh's new Charity of the Year,  Finance Director Neil Chidgey has pledged to brave the shave in lockdown and shave his head if we can raise £250 for The Trussell Trust.

As lockdown ensued to prevent further outbreak of the coronavirus, the number of people needing food banks hit a record high, with issued food parcels doubling in the space of a week.

Sadly, food bank use has gradually risen in our communities for a number of years now, but at this difficult time, they are crucial in preventing people from being further swept into poverty.

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children.

They continue to do an incredible job in tough circumstances so please donate.

Description:
One of my friends is turning 50 this week and instead of receiving presents, has asked us to give £10 in an act of kindness to someone else and make their day. 

Another of my friends, for her job, has just carried out extensive research about food banks in Surrey. There are over 30 now, in an area that is better off than in many places in the UK. And the people using them are people who are working. Imagine getting home from the office and not being able to afford to eat. I am giving the £10 my 50-something friend has given me for others to The Trussell Trust who run the food banks here, but please would you also give something too? I am going to fast for 24 hours to incentivise you! Thank you for helping.

Description:
My friends collected lots of food for our local food bank which inspired me to help as well. I am cycling the distance from home to the hospital in London where I was born and back again which is 28 miles. I am not going to cycle it in one day but over one week. I will post updates to tell you how I am getting on!


UK food banks have faced record demand during the coronavirus crisis and The Trussell Trust issued 50,000 food parcels in one week, almost double their normal volume. https://www.theguardian.com/society/2020/may/01/uk-food-banks-face-record-demand-in-coronavirus-crisis

Title: DyserthTimes Sponsor a Scarecrow

Description:
Later this week we’ll be running a potato 5k to raise some money for St Giles Trust’s food bank.

The team, including my cousin, have been working flat out since the COVID outbreak and are now feeding 650 people a week in 18 London boroughs. 

In the past two months they have seen many of their clients lose their jobs, struggle to afford basic essentials and keep up with their utility bills. 

Over 650 vulnerable people in London are now receiving supplies of fresh, healthy food and being supported with meal planning advice. 

Many of St Giles Trust’s clients were already in challenging circumstances and are at high risk from the Covid pandemic so the security of a regular supply of nutritious, healthy food has been a real source of comfort and security.

If you’d like to chip in we’d love your support!

Title: Christmas 2018

Description:
I've been growing my hair for a while now, in part due to laziness, in part to see what it looks like. Today I got sent home from work as my girlfriend has a cough, and this is where I must stay for the next two weeks. I fortunately have enough food in my house for this time, but perspective is important. Thousands are currently at risk as they don't have this privilege. It is for this reason that, from my isolation, I want to help and I encourage you to too. 

The longer one's hair becomes, the more daunting the idea is to cut it. At present my messy mop has taken numerous months of cultivation. I've defended it's appearance to my girlfriend, my colleagues and my family. Now it will go. The more I raise the shorter it will be cut. Now is the chance to see my whole head gleaming like a fortune teller's crystal ball.
Title: A Sped Up Recession

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Annoying day by Abigail

Description:
Anne is offering virtual photoshoots to a limited number of small business owners in exchange for a £25 donation to The Trussell Trust.  

All you need is an iPhone, good internet connection, good natural light and a good sense of fun!  You'll be in *your* home, and Anne will be in hers - a little planning, a date is set, and the magic begins!

These are perfect for lockdown - a distraction, a bit of fun, and you'll have images to use on social media for your business. Places are limited, so get in touch with Anne at studio@annethomasphotography.co.uk for bookings.

More about The Trussell Trust

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure. We're working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Title: Helen Thomas & Helen Whitaker are eating healthily on 1 pound a day (weekdays in Lent)

Description:
(Note: Full Details and Entry Form are included at the bottom as updates and can be extracted for printing)

With the economic fall out of Covid-19 and lock down about to hit millions are going to be out of work for a sustained period whilst the Country and the World begins to recover.

It is essential that we come together to support those that have lost their jobs and income and now have essential monthly outgoings far greater than their incomes, we can help to ensure that during this recovery nobody goes hungry by supporting food banks and by raising awareness to those in need that they can lean on a food bank.

Whilst many have looked to better themselves during Covid-19 lock down by taking up baking, cycling, jogging, learning a musical instrument, sorting the garden, or maybe decorating that spare bedroom that’s been used for nothing but storage since moving in, some of us have adopted the Jim Royale approach of sitting on our backsides and using the time and lack of human contact as an excuse not to shave.

Whilst resisting the razor at first was born out of idleness, after a month of growth it has become a unique challenge of perseverance, the itching, food getting stuck in the hair, moustache growing into the mouth, and the face of a Rabid dog foaming at the mouth in the mirror after brushing my teeth every day is starting to take its toll.
As lockdown begins to end, and with barber shops looking to reopen in July, a return to a clean shaven face is in desperate need.
Rather than a ritual hacking at the face resulting in some inevitable plug hole blocking and a trip to A&E due to blood loss from the shaving wounds I have decided to auction off my facial hair for a one off redesign to be carried out in July when the barber shops reopen with the goal of raising some money for a charity in the process.

Okay now to the fun part!

Essentially my facial hair is up for grabs to the highest bidder through a blind auction, the highest donation wins!

Each entrant using the forms provided as a guide (but feel free to go off piste and design with your own templates computers etc) designs a pattern for my facial hair to be shaped into.

Designs need to accept the existing length (plus 1 month of growth from the image at the start), unfortunately that’s the canvas!

Designs should be wild and can include colour dye. I must then wear the final design in public for a minimum of 5 days, I will provide photographs and video evidence that I have adhered to the 5 day minimum.

The Rules

1. Designs are to be submitted by email to gary.townsend@hitachirail-eu.com with the subject title “shave me silly” in the subject title also include a reference to your just giving donation/bid (see point 10).

2. Designs are to be non offensive, any offensive designs will be rejected and donations/bids will not be refunded. As a guide the following are out:- Religious symbols, gang/cult symbols including swastikas, rude words, phalluses (look up the word if you don’t know it) are definitely out! Football related designs (I’m a proud Spurs supporter and I’m not slipping on that Banana skin!), in short go wild but be respectful of others that will have to look at my face once your design has been enacted.

3. Anything considered head hair/above the centre eye line is off limits! Nature is doing a good enough job fettling that hair down! The template provides a rough cut off line as a guide.

4. At the end of the 5 days the final design will be removed from my face.

5. All entry designs will be shared in a summary once the auction has closed, along with the winning entrants design.

6. The highest bid design adhering to point 2 wins.

7. All designs are to have an accompanying Just Giving donation with the amount hidden (it is a blind auction!) if you do not hide the amount your design will be rejected and your donation/bid will not be refunded.

8. To avoid it being obvious as to what is the highest bid I recommend making multiple bids and the sum total will be considered your auction bid, ie: if you want to bid £35, then make 3 separate anonymous donations of £10, £20, and £5, this way others won’t know if you are the highest bid.

9. The closing date for all bids/designs is 23:59 on the 15th of July 2020.

10. Make your donation/bid and be sure to tick the Hide donation amount from public view box, it is a blind auction so any submitted designs with donations/bids public will be rejected.

Be sure to include a means to reference your donation to your design submitted in point 1, this can be done in one of 3 ways:-

a) Display your name in public view on by NOT ticking the box “Hide my name and photo from public view”

b) Share your contact details with me on  by ticking the box “I’m happy to share my contact details with Gary Townsend”

c) Leave a message with your bid/donation on Just Giving with your design name 

Please give as much as you can, I realise I like many of you may have been fortunate during this pandemic to have continued earning without the normal outgoings of a commute to work for example so why not dentate all or part of your commuting saving?
Perhaps you missed a trip to the cinema or getting your haircut so perhaps you can donate £10-£20 accordingly?
Maybe you have been refunded a concert or sport event ticket cancelled due to Covid-19, why not donate that refund?
Or perhaps the pub closures have forced you to raid the supermarket alcohol aisles resulting in a cheaper Friday drink, why not donate a pub outing to the cause?

In practice please look to donate what you can afford, and all donations no matter how big or small are appreciated.
Title: Shave me Silly

Description:
Over the coming weeks, we’d like for people to get involved and to do something creative. It can be art, knitting, a funny video, a poem about life in quarantine - just about anything creative! 

As you've submitted your 'work',  please upload to the charity auction folder on the planning Sharepoint site. 

People can then check out the collection and go to Just giving, donate money and write which item they are 'bidding' (donating) for. 

Hopefully we end up with a rich collection of inspiring and fun creations, it will also be interesting to see the diversity of talent across the department :). There is also no such thing as no talent. To quote Sophie Parker, 'Always be proud of your work!'

All the donations will go to Trussell Trust. The charity has over 1,200 food bank centres in the UK network which they use to provide emergency support to those in need of food during COVID-19 and beyond.
Title: Mindshare - Embrace your inner artist!

Description:
Every morning for 26 days we are going to run a mile around Well Street Common to raise money for this brilliant charity.

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Thank you all.
Title: The Trussell Trust Weekend Fundraiser page

Description:
From 23 April until 24 May, Muslims around the world are fasting from dawn till dusk in the holy month of Ramadan, with the purpose of teaching discipline, sacrifice, and empathy for those who are less fortunate.

When Ramadan comes to an end, Muslims will wish each other Eid Mubarak (“Happy Holidays”), and this year we’re asking you to join the spirit of Ramadan, whether you are Muslim or not, and support FEED Mubarak!

Trussel Trust do an incredible job campaigning to stop UK hunger, supporting food banks nationwide for people locked in poverty.

You can donate directly online, or take donations to your local food bank. Food banks are currently short on donations for Halal food specifically, as well as canned, non-perishable goods and well-in-date, easily packageable food (with no manual separation needed).

My sister and I are taking part in the Hatfield Broad Oak 10k race in support of our local food bank.  As a short, fat, unfit man, I'm not aiming for a time - I just plan on finishing it.

Bishop's Stortford might be an affluent area but there are pockets of deprivation.  Because people often assume everyone this way is well off, help for people in poverty here is limited.  Food poverty is a real thing in our community.  No child should go hungry yet every day they do.  That is why we are running to raise money for the local food bank.

James and I have been doing a lot of cycling during lockdown. James has grown hugely in confidence and loves zooming down hills, weaving through woods and, most recently, skidding! At times I genuinely struggle to keep up with him!

We've decided to try and raise some money for Bishop's Stortford Food Bank by riding 500 miles in two months. We are struck by how covid has affected people in so many ways and sadly the need for food banks is greater than ever. 

James' original target was 25 miles but he'd smashed that within 2 weeks and so we made it more challenging. His new target is 100 miles over the two months, and I'm aiming to ride at least 400 miles.

Title: Chantal's Christmas

Description:
Why am I asking for your money?

My wife and children decided to volunteer at the Kingsbridge Area Foodbank at the start of the Covid-19 outbreak. The children are keen participants in the Malborough and District Kids theatre group and the pantos so they have created a song. You can see their customised version of ”Where is love” from Oliver here: youtu.be/qBhFYFel4lw to try and persuade you all to donate some money to the Foodbank's cause. Please watch the video and give whatever you can spare to help support families in need.

Who will receive the money

The Kingsbridge Area Foodbank is a wonderful organisation that has been supporting families and individuals for 8 years but lately the demand for their services has soared to new levels. My wife chose to volunteer with the foodbank, while on furlough from her job in Kingsbridge, and has seen the enormous pressure they are suddenly under. I think the numbers of people being helped have jumped from around 25 to 110 per week. They have already had some very kind donations but, as you can imagine, the demand is using up the money fast. To try and raise money my children came up with the idea of singing a song here so please give it a watch and, if you can, donate to this worthwhile cause.

Why you really should care

I wanted to mention one last thing that has really stuck with my wife. when she visited a family recently. The main earner was self-employed and his business had been forced to stop. As you may know, that means the family will not receive support until June. The lady that answered the door ended up in tears as she explained that she never expected to be in this situation. I have to admit it was very moving to hear her story but thank goodness the Foodbank has been able to help. Please help if you can and if, like the lady above, you find yourself in need, get in touch. There is no judgement, they just want to help.

Thank you and stay safe,

Jason, Tamara, Olly and Charlotte
Title: Charity Song for Kingsbridge Foodbank

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page so much which will raise lots of money for the local food bank.

To swim the English Channel to France is 21 miles which is 33,840m or 3,384 lengths of our 10m pool. We aim to each swim to France by swimming at least 40 lengths each a day which should take us 84 days.  

We have chosen Nourish as our charity which is a local food bank in Tunbridge Wells.  There are lots of people who will be struggling to feed themselves and their families because they are unable to work because of Coronavirus.

Title: Twggs Charity Fundraising Covid-19

Description:
Thank you for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

As a school we have worked with this incredible charity for some time but over recent weeks and days Nourish have been at the forefront of our minds. 

Many pupils, staff and families from Holmewood House have been wanting to get involved in some way to help our wider community during these difficult and uncertain times of COVID-19.

Nourish is a registered charity that provides short-term emergency provisions, support and signposting in a crisis to individuals and families within the borough of Tunbridge Wells, South Tonbridge and the surrounding areas.

Their  mission is that no-one need go hungry in Tunbridge Wells and the surrounding areas.

We are therefore reaching out to the friends and families of our Holmewood community to invite them to give their support in any way that they can.

Thank you.
Title: Holmewood House School

CharityName: The Food Bank (an initiative of Into the Community)
Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. 

After yesterday's humbling experience, as detailed below, I know we can all make a difference to other people's lives by just taking five minutes out of our busy day and donating a small amount of money. I would love to raise £1000 pounds for the Food Bank in Worcester to help put a smile on numerous family faces this Christmas. Can you spare £5.00 and go without that bottle of wine, others can't even afford a loaf of bread to feed their children and we sit eating takeaways in front of the TV in our lovely warm homes. Please help me by SHARING this post and donate what you can.... The more we share, the more people we reach, the more we can raise and the more people we can make SMILE! Come on Facebookers lets do sometime productive and help the people who really need it!.

" I took my dogs for a walk last night and found myself walking and walking after over five miles I found myself at a local pub! The dogs were welcome in and I sat alone in the corner waiting for my husband to pick me up when I got talking to a stranger. One hour later it transpires that the guy was an ex- serviceman who due to PTS had found himself living locally in a tent, we got talking and although his life was tough he took nothing from the government but did odd jobs in order to provide for himself. I brought him a pint and later my son and husband turned up, he offered to buy us all a drink which I decided as we were driving, he still came back from the bar with three orange juices. We have so much and he has nothing but yet he still brought us a drink which he could not afford. We all have so much in life and yet others have nothing and yet they are willing to share what they have! My son learnt so much tonight, on the way home he asked if we could give all his old toys to other people for Christmas that didn't have things for Christmas! Tomorrow I am off to do a weeks shop and leave it with the landlord to give to that man as last night was a truly moving experience not just for me but for my entire family! A Ramon night but such a humbling evening... Please help me by donating to the local Food Bank, its amazing how much satisfaction you get from helping others rather than enriching our already saturated lives.

Please donate through:-

CharityName: The Food Bank (an initiative of Into the Community)
Description:
Amidst the Coronavirus crisis, the people of Milton Keynes are in dire need of our local foodbank more than ever before. Whole families in previously secure jobs have suddenly found themselves thrust into poverty and struggling to put food on the table, through no fault of their own. And the worst is yet to come. 

The foodbank is struggling to meet demand, with food packages going out as soon as the donations come in.

The people of MK need your help now more than ever. I know finances are tight for all of us right now, but please if you can spare even a small amount, you'll be making a big difference right now!

My goal is to cycle 200 miles over the next 30 days, in order to help raise funds, support and feed those in need. Please, let's all chip in to help those who are really in a desperate place right now...
Title: Joe's Cycle 200

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

My name is Alice. I am nine years old  and I live in Bishop's Stortford . Like most children I am home from school, this upsets me because it means I can't visit my grandparents in the Easter holidays which I was looking forward to doing. Instead I have decided to virtually cycle to them in April, starting with Nanny in Bishop's Stortford and finishing with Grandmaman and Grandpa in Dorset. This means cycling, on our exercise bike, about 7k every day throughout April to make it up to 206k to reach Dorset by the end of the month. I have decided to do this to keep active and raise money for the Bishop's Stortford food bank, as I feel they will need donations even more so during this outbreak.

Title: SBSUK Distance Challenge

Description:
The Trussel Trust support those most in need across the United Kingdom. No one in this country should go hungry and it is a sad state of affairs that reliance on food banks is growing daily. Over a six month period from April-September 2019, 823,145 three day emergency food parcels were given to people in crisis in the U.K over a third of these, (301,653) went to children. To put that in to perspective that's a 23% increase on the same period the following year.

Anything that you can give to help support the Trussel Trust and the national food bank will be greatly appreciated.

I had aimed to run three marathons and several shorter races during 2020, but most have obviously been cancelled or postponed because of Coronavirus. Instead I have changed the challenge to me running as many miles as I can during 2020. I will still undertake challenges to keep the motivation going. 

The biggest challenge was to run 100 miles in a week from the 25th-31st of May as part of a virtual running challenge which included a 55 mile lap of the Isle of Arran which I completed in roughly 9 hours 45 minutes on a very hot day! 

After a disappointing summer running wise due to injury (I couldn’t really run properly for 3-4 months) I am now back to roughly running 40 miles a week. So far this year I have completed 1733 miles in 250 hours of running with an elevation gain of 172,000ft.

I am aiming to run at least one more marathon before the end of the year..

 Make sure that those in need have food this Christmas time by supporting the national food bank.

Thanks for visiting my justgiving page.
Title: Running as many miles as I can in 2020!

Title: Tippler's Live Lounge

Description:
WHY?

I just fancy a little physical challenge that I can do anywhere. Why not use it to stick a few extra quid in the food banks at the same time?  

ALSO...

I was supposed to be boxing in March but the fight was pulled because of the virus.  Eventually the boxing gym people are going to ring me up and say "Hey, your fight's back on.  What sort of condition are you in?" and I'd like to not have to lie through my teeth about how I've maintained some ring fitness. Fair? 

THE EXERCISE

If you've ever been in the military or to a decent gym you will know the burpee.  It's a full-body conditioning exercise and notoriously difficult.  It also has a lot of variations (see below).  

FOR THE FITNESS PEDANTS OUT THERE...

I've known a few PTs and similar types get very excited indeed about what constitutes a 'proper' burpee.  

My burpees for this challenge will include a squat, a kick-out to a plank, a full press-up (nose to floor), a return to the squat position, and then a jump with arms by my sides.  I don't do the 'arms-in-the-air' variation because I usually train indoors with low ceilings and I quite like having functional wrists...

If you think this is "not a proper burpee" then, sorry, but my challenge, my rules!

Sounds easy?  Give me 100 of those for time and then come back to me...

Description:
Liliana has just recently learnt to ride her bike. With this current climate she wanted to do something to support families in need. She will be dressing up and riding her bike for 3 miles a day for 5 days. Please support her in making a little difference to a very good cause.

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Lilianas daily 3 mile fancy dress bike ride

Description:
We are very shaken by the current pandemic that is afflicting the world. This is an unprecedented challenge, and we don’t yet know how things will unfold.

Supermarket shelves are empty. People are filling up their own trollies and cupboards to try to deal with the panic of an unknown pandemic - and food banks up and down the country are running out of food. Last year, food banks in Trussell Trust's network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can end the need for food banks.

We expect no one should be left hungry or destitute.

We have put together a series of live streams that will be broadcasted on our platforms on Fridays and on Saturdays, as a sign of hope, unity and positivity for those who want to spend 1 hour in our company and enjoy the music we love, analyse and discuss some fundemantal topics for us and share knowledge, culture and innovation around the world. Furthermore, we will act in compliance with the rules as this will ensure the safety of both, those who make the recordings and those who listen to them, in order to promote temporary social distancing.

Join us on facebook.com/ComaSoundLTD/ at 7PM (UK Time) every Friday and Saturday during this lockdown that has been imposed upon us.

All the money raised here goes directly to the Trussell Trust, who will use it to support people in need and at risk of food insecurity and hunger throughout the UK.

If you can't afford to donate - sharing it on social media and enjoying some quality music is free! Thank you for your support.

--------------

Coma was born on the 3rd of December 2010 as a platform for new and talented artists to develop and emerge alongside well known artists who hardly performed in the U.K. before and whom brought a new emphasis to the U.K.'s underground electronic music scene. comahq.com

The Trussell Trust, in conjunction with local communities, develops and runs sustainable projects in the UK tackling poverty and exclusion. Through the UK Foodbank Network and Community Enterprises we work with marginalised people in real need, providing practical care and support. trusselltrust.org

Title: Vicky's Kilimanjaro - Lockdown style

Description:
Even before Covid, there has been a huge increase in the need for food banks. I aim to raise £1,000 for the Trussel Trust, which is a national food bank charity. 

I believe that the fallout from the Covid-19 pandemic in the UK will result in hundreds of thousands, if not millions of additional people unable to cope financially, though no fault of their own - mostly due to a massive increase in unemployment. So, food banks have already come under increasing pressure. When the furlough scheme ends this will almost certainly become even worse.

I am working from home and 'shielding' for an unknown number of weeks or months, and wanted to help the outside world cope with the current crisis somehow: hence my exercise bike 'cycling' challenge,

I normally use the exercise bike for 2-3 hours a week so, my Cycling target is a challenge. A few days ago, I had the idea, so I used Google Maps to see how far that would be: 1,530 kilometres - 950 miles.

Starting on Friday 8th May, VE Day, this should allow me to 'get to John O'Groats' by VJ Day: Saturday 15th August, if not before. Feel free to donate here for the Trussel Trust.

I originally thought this might take me about three months, but I have got noticeably faster as I progresssed, so that I now expect to reach 1,530 Km around the 10th of July.
Title: Andrew's exercise bike challenge

Description:
I have always said I would volunteer at a food bank because I feel so sad that I live in a world where they have to exist. However I have also always given myself the excuse that ‘I don’t have time to help’ so in light of current events and the families that must be struggling so much in this situation, I have decided to try and raise a few pennies.

If you can spare a few coins please do.
Title: Mark's Head Shave

Description:
The 17th of May was meant to have been my last scheduled performance with The King & I, at the New Wimbledon Theatre. Sadly, due to CoViD-19, this was not to be. I am singing "I Have Dreamed" from the production, because I had a really great time on tour and wanted to commemorate it by helping a good cause.

Since the lockdown began, the use of food banks in the UK has skyrocketed. Over the weekend, we found out that our local food bank, the Wimbledon Food Bank, is critically low on supplies to support those in need.

I hope you enjoy the song. If you are able to, please consider making a donation to The Trussell Trust, who run food banks across the UK including the Wimbledon Food Bank via this page which my mum has helped me set up. Every little helps. Thank you, and stay safe!

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I'm going to be doing a 7 day water fast between 09/11/2016 - 16/11/2016. This involves not eating or drinking anything other than water for 7 days.

More than 13 million people live below the poverty line in the UK and this is as high as 10% of people in Scotland. The Trussell Trust helps to provide for these individuals and families through food banks.

The main reason for me doing this is to raise a lot of money for the charity and hopefully help a lot of people, but also to experience what it is like to go try and go about my normal life after not eating for a few days which is what some people have to do when providing for their families.

Title: Liams fast for food

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Poverty in this country is becoming a real issue. The use of food banks has increased by 97% in the  last year. It's heartbreaking to think that in the 21st century, there were families this Christmas that had no food and no presents for their children. Women have to rely on food banks for sanitary items, due to their vast expense. Issues with universal credit have left many families without any money over the Christmas period. The fallout from poverty is enormous; mental health issues, access to health services, travel, employment, access to healthy food, happy and well cared for children. 

Without foodbanks, many people in poverty would have NO access to food at all. They provide a safe space. Somewhere warm and dry. They can also offer support and advice to those in need, who may be isolated or unsure of their options. We have nurses in this country who have to use foodbanks, just to survive. I can't change the way this country is going (I wish I could), but if I can do something, even if it's only a small contribution, then I feel like I've helped in some way. Also, please donate food to local foodbanks whenever you can. You never know when you might have to rely on their services yourself. You can visit: 

https://www.trusselltrust.org/get-help/find-a-foodbank/?gclid=EAIaIQobChMI_43Akrex2AIVZLftCh0_TQCUEAAYASAAEgL6FvD_BwE and enter a postcode to find your local foodbanks. 

Donate by text by texting VAPE67 to 70070. For a £1 donation, text VAPE67 £1.  Minimum is £1 

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Jen's Dry January to raise money for Trussell Trust

Description:
Due to the Coronavirus outbreak enquires to the food banks have gone up threefold and donations have plummeted. Last year food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Just imagine that this year around 4 million food parcels  may be needed, at the point where food bank reserves are at their lowest. We need to help people with their absolute basics to get through this crisis. 

So as a light hearted incentive in troubling times I am asking you to guess Georgie’s breed makeup. Just look at those ears...who do they belong to? Does she really have donkey in her DNA or is this a red herring? We will find out exactly what she is in April......

Some clues:

She loves to snuggle up in bed

She is as fast as the speed of light.....

Cat’s however chase her

She can be a bit naughty and stubborn 

She loves all humans

She gets over excited, especially with ball games

Bees and flies ( and presumably wasps) are worth chasing



The person/s guessing the nearest combination will have a special prize. (To be decided) To enter please donate anything on this page and please leave your name.
Title: Julia's Guess The Breed Results are In

Description:
On 1st May 2020, Smith Goodfellow celebrated 40 years in business. It's a huge milestone for us, especially given the current global pandemic and the impact it's having on small businesses like ours around the world.  Because community is one of the most important things to us as a business, and a team, we want to celebrate by giving back. Over the next 12 months, we will be undertaking 40 good deeds, big and small, to support our local community, other businesses and charities close to our hearts. 

We're kicking off by walking, running, cycling and dancing 400 miles in 40 days to raise money for The Trussell Trust. This is not your usual sponsored walk/cycle/run because several members of the team are self isolating - we're going to be getting creative and completing our miles in all sorts of ways, including exercise bikes, step machines! 

We've chosen to support The Trussell Trust for this because we want to support the vital service that they offer. More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year. Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure. The Trussell Trust are working closely with their network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how each food bank can be best supported in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Anything you can give to help this worthy cause will make a difference. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for being part of our 40 year journey and for helping us give back to communities across the UK. We hope you are staying safe and well.
Title: Smith Goodfellow's 400 for 40

Description:
More than ever before, people are having to rely on food banks to feed their families throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. So I’ve decided to try and help out - raising funds for the Trussell Trust by running a marathon over a week. That’s only 6km a day, which sounds easy enough on day one but might not feel it by day seven!

I’ll be starting on Monday 18 May and running each day to finish on Sunday 24 May. I’ll be doing the challenge together in spirit - but not actually in person - with some of my friends from the Dorking Outdoor Fitness group.

The Trussell Trust supports a nationwide network of food banks, as well as campaigning to help those locked in poverty in the UK. It has seen a massive 81% increase in need for emergency food parcels since the end of March and an even greater rise in food parcels given to children.

It would be amazing if you could spare anything to help them continue their vital work and get food to those who need it most.

I’ll let you know how I get on!

Thank you,

Nicola

P.S. This is a close as I’ll get to running an actual marathon!!

Title: MUSIC THAT GIVES charity event

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

SANTA PUNCHES POVERTY;  donate 1.00

When somebody asks me....”are you excited about Christmas?”, my answer is ALWAYS a resounding YES!! It’s the season of goodwill, a time for friends and family, a happy time for all.....well almost all.

What if you don’t have any friends? What if you don’t have any money? What if you don’t have a home?

It is reported by local authorities that there are over 200,000 people registered as homeless here in the UK, more if you count those that “the system” misses; for more detailed information visit the following link:-

https://crisis.org.uk/media/236823/homelessness_monitor_england_2017.pdf

What will Christmas mean to this ridiculously high number of people?

The answer....the exact opposite to how you and I feel. Imagine how being cold and hungry throughout our winter months feels.......try it for a night, I guarantee you’ll not be doing it again.

Homelessness affects people of all ages, old, young, middle aged....a high percentage suffering with a Mental Health issue.

So if you’re willing, here’s what I suggest we do, either donate just 1.00 direct to the Trussell Trust to support their campaign “stopping UK hunger”.

A link to the Trussel Trusts website directory is below:-

https://www.trusselltrust.org/

OR.....

Imagine what a MASSIVE difference it would make to our country’s needy if every day throughout December we all put aside at least 1 tin or packet of food as a donation, and once a week delivered what we have collected to a local Food-Bank?

The Trussell Trust, a fantastic charity trying to “stop UK hunger”, have a searchable directory of Food-Banks listed on their website that rely almost entirely on the general public for food and drink donations. I guarantee that every single one of these Food-Banks will be inundated with requests for food and drink from Britain's Homeless over the coming festive season.

If you’re up for the challenge, register here, visit the Trussell Trusts website to locate your nearest Food-Bank, and let’s start giving.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/santa-punches-poverty-tickets-39698608607

One last thing to ask, let’s flood Social Media with the tag #santapunchespoverty and show our support for the UK‘s homeless society, showing the powers that be that homelessness is simply not acceptable in this day and age.

Thank you for reading, and let’s give generously!

Please feel free to post photographs of you and your family and friends "giving" on yours and my Twitter page.

Dave

@secbus


Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Title: Enra 's Week of Kindness

Description:
With the world the way it is right now, there are some very vulnerable people at this horrible time. However, the amazing people at The Trussell Trust  are currently sending out food boxes to those who need it most. Because of the current situation, supermarket drop off donations have fallen, yet the demand for the boxes (roughly worth around £8-£13 each) are growing. 

So...

On Sunday 5th April, I will be streaming two live internet dance classes for young people and their families (I know you all want to join in!!!), to support this cause. There is no set fee for class entry, and can be completely free of charge if needs be. However, if you do have any spare change, even a £2 donation for the class would be amazing and would go towards helping those who are most vulnerable. 

Schedule will be as follows:

11am--11:45am - General ability (roughly 6-12 years old) - This class will be aimed as a fun, carefree and enjoyable 45 minutes of exercise for those who enjoy dancing!

Via this link >>> 
https://us04web.zoom.us/j/724021434

Meeting ID: 724 021 434

12pm-1pm - Intermediate/Advanced (roughly 12-18+ years old) - This class will be aimed for those who currently take part in dance lessons, and for the young ones who fancy something a bit more challenging!

Sam Freeman is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting.

Via this link >>> 
https://us04web.zoom.us/j/389283838

Meeting ID: 389 283 838

The class will be via a Zoom video link (accessible through smartphones or the internet). 

IMPORTANT INFO:

On the day, follow the link to join in! Any questions, feel free to email me at movementbyswf@gmail.com

Hope to see as many of you, virtually, there as possible!

Title: Help Families over Christmas

Description:
Unprecedented times call for unprecedented measures.  

I've always admired the Mohican, I think the office would have loved it.  I can imagine them bursting into smiles as I came in for the first time after having one.   

I'll be at home for the foreseeable future and willing to get this much desired haircut, groomed expertly by my household quarantine mate Giedre.  

All it takes to get this off the ground is for you, my friends and family, to donate £100 to instant neighbor to provide emergency food parcels to those in need along with nappies and essential babycare equipment to parents in need in Aberdeen area. 

If we got to £200, I'd dyed it yellow like the picture.  Let's see how it goes...  Monday the clippers come out!

Title: Clare's page

Description:
“ No human should go to sleep without food “

We are two typical 15 year olds. We enjoy activities such as gaming, watching Netflix and hanging out with friends. However COVID-19 has changed everything around us, which also meant that we could not meet  each other and our friends in lockdown. This period of uncertainty made us realise that there are so many people out there who are not as fortunate as us, cannot even afford food and  starving for days ! These people need our urgent help in this Pandemic.

This is why we have decided to challenge ourselves to walk 40 km in a single day from Bourne End  to Reading on weekend of 25th July.

We have chosen to raise money for “The  Trussel trust “. We believe that they are the right organisation to help the hungry in these difficult times.

We would be very grateful if you can make a difference in their lives by supporting us on this  journey and save many lives  as every penny counts and every little helps. Thank you for reading our story and we hope you can help this noble cause. !

“ There is  no exercise better for the heart than reaching down and lifting people up “ very powerful line by John Holmes.

Thanks and regards

Sarth and Aditya

Description: Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. I’m not running a marathon or doing anything heroic like that, I just want to try to raise a bit of money to support The Trussell Trust, the UK’s main food bank charity, because I believe coronavirus panic buying at supermarkets by people who can financially afford to panic buy is wiping supermarket shelves clean of even the absolute basic essentials that people less fortunate than many of us can barely afford anyway. If you yourself have a few quid to spare, please help. What’s £10? A packet of fags or a takeaway pizza. Please help stop the Coronavirus Poverty Gap.

Title: Manchester marathon for the trussel trust

Description:
Cyril, aged 6, decided to shave his head for the 'Trussell Trust' which is a vital food bank for people who are struggling financially. So many more people are struggling in these hard times.

I thought I'd keep him company and shave my head...again! 

Last time I did this was 2015 when my oldest, Olive, was nearly 3 and Cyril was 18 months. My youngest, Maud, is now 2 and a half. I raised £5000 for Cancer Research, as a joint effort with a friend, and donated my hair to 'The Little Princess Trust' who make wigs for children that have lost their hair due to cancer treatments.

I hope to donate to The Little Princess Trust again when they are up and running again. Blonde hair this time!

I am not expecting to raise anything near £5000 this time due to the current financial worries a lot of people will be faced with.

If all this does is save me from the worst root regrowth then so be it! 

Some people said bald suited me last time- it didn't and certainly doesn't this time as I am fatter, paler and older!

We are asking for anyone who can spare anything at all to donate to this worthy cause please and/or 'Share' as much as you can on any social media! 

Thank you,

Cyril and Claire. xxx

Title: Shaving my head for charity :)

Description:
In this period of Coronavirus lockdown there is increased pressure on the food banks for a variety of reasons:-

  • Unexpected job losses and increase in demand for supplies.
  • Regular donators being on lockdown.
  • Supermarket restrictions on purchasing multiple items.
  • Closure of many community buildings which act as drop off points for donations.

There is an amazing team of people working in the Bromley warehouse and in the centres, but they can only work with what has been donated.

Last year, food banks in their network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, they can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

I am hoping that I can help to raise funds to help them to keep supporting those that need them in the community.

I will buzz cut my hair to No. 6 all over if my full target is met. If I don't meet the target I should still like to keep your donations and would be happy to sport a suitable haircut commensurate with the amount raised - the more money, the more extreme. If I smash my target it could be a No 5 or shorter!!!

Please help.

Description:

Title: A 3 year old shaves Eoin's head

Description:
August 2021 update: I’ll be riding a 5-day bike tour around southern England, starting with a loop around the North Downs, then riding from Guildford to Salisbury, the New Forest, Portsmouth, round the Isle of Wight and back to Guildford. After such generous sponsorship last year, I’m not pushing for it this time but there remains great need for the Trussell Trust food banks, even more so now with supermarket shortages and Brexit price rises. So if you’ve made it here, please consider a kind donation while I ride with a strapped-up hamstring!

______________________________________________________

To mark turning 50, I’ve been planning to cycle the story of my life, from where I was born, Guisborough in the North Riding of Yorkshire, via all the places in this country I’ve lived in – taking in Kirby, Oxford, Reading, Guildford, Reigate and London – to end in Cambridge.

It was just going to be a personal challenge to mark a significant milestone. However, having spent my 50th birthday in the pandemic lockdown, I wanted to turn the bike tour into a chance to raise money for the Trussell Trust, whose food banks so many people rely on and which sadly is in even greater demand now as the severe economic hardship for many during this crisis intensifies.

I will be setting off on Sunday 19th July. I’ll provide updates throughout the bike tour on my dedicated Twitter account: https://twitter.com/phil50biketour

Thank you for anything you are able to give to help the Trussell Trust help those who most need it.

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, the Trussell Trust can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Title: David's isolation cut - hair to impress!

Description:
Inspired by other similar charity events I have decided to complete my staircase version of the three peaks challenge. Anyone who knows me will be familiar with my love of the mountains, obviously I can’t get out there at the moment, so I have decided to climb the equivalent combined  height of the highest peaks in Scotland, Wales and England (not Britain’s there highest peaks - they're all in Scotland). I’m trying to raise money for the Trussel Trust who provide much needed food banks across the country, sadly needed at the best of times but even more important at this time of crisis. Please help me.

I need to ascend 15,660 steps in total. That’s 1205 times up and down the stairs.

Scafell Pike 4500 steps, Snowdon 4610 steps, Ben Nevis 6550 steps.

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Stephen's Three Peak Challenge - Staircase version

Description:
I'm taking part in the Stay At Home Sleepout to raise funds for people who are homeless and in poverty. The money raised will go towards supporting local food banks that help the homeless and vulnerable gain access to vital supplies.

Now more than ever there are millions of people relying on food banks to help feed themselves and their family, if you are in a position to help I would love if you could donate to help support the cause! 

What I'm actually doing:

Come 8PM June 1st I will be taking up residence in my back garden until the following morning, sleeping out in a sleeping bag. I am hoping that it doesn't rain otherwise it will be a very soggy experience indeed, however, even if it did, I have the luxury of going back inside the following morning, having a hot meal and a bath whereas the people we are hoping to help do not, they have no home. 

Anyone that knows me knows I hate shadowy places and things that go bump in the night so sleeping outside without the comfort of a tent is so not my thing! I will be posting updates throughout the night and hopefully be able to raise some money to help those in need! 

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page :)
Title: CEO Sleepout

Description: I will be taking part in Celtic FC Foundation's Zip Slide in Paradise event on Monday, April 13. I will be sliding diagonally from East to West, leaving from the very top corner of the North Stand seating deck, at the Lisbon Lions Stand side, and gliding all the way across to the lower corner of the Jock Stein at the Main Stand side. I have been tasked with raising a minimum of £130 in support of Celtic FC Foundation.
Title: Zip Slide in Paradise 2020

Description:
In these unprecedented times, food banks will be more important than ever. Children that would have relied on free school meals may not receive them, thousands will lose jobs, and food poverty will undoubtedly rise. I've had my beloved beard for over five years and I've forgotten what my own face looks like. If I raise £200, I'll shave it off (and my girlfriend has agreed she can't leave me).

Trussell Trust's story:

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Description:
Not to be out done by the famous Jake’s May 5k A Day  fundraising effort (aka Mr Andrew from Midsomer Norton Primary School) I’ve decided to join him by climbing my stairs at home 100 hundred times everyday throughout May. At the very least I should be able to egg him on... He’s quite competitive don’t you know.

See daily themed(!) updates by visiting Midsomer Norton Primary School and Nursery’s Facebook page.

Update 5th May. Thank you for everybody’s support to help me reach my original goal of £300. Still 26 days to go so I’ve increased the target to £500.

Please share!
Title: Alun's 100 stairs a day challenge

Description:
We have decided to have some fun, put down our screens and raise money for a well deserving cause. 

We are swimming 21 miles (33.8km) in our garden pool, that’s 5200 lengths. We are currently 7.7kms from Dover (virtually of course!) and we plan to reach Calais by the end of May!

We know we are a very fortunate family of four so we have decided to raise money for the Trussell Trust, who provide much needed food and basic supplies to families across the UK from their network of over 1,200 food banks.

The Trussell Trust

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: The Aquaticuffs Virtually Swim the English Channel

Description:
In this time of unprecedented crisis, many have lost their livelihoods and income meaning food security has become an even greater concern within our community and food banks are vital. 

In an effort to fundraise for The Trussell Trust food bank network I will be shaving my head and donating my hair to the Little Princess Trust who provide free, real hair wigs to children with hair loss and fund crucial research into childhood cancers. 

Unfortunately, given the current situation, the Little Princess Trust are understandably unable to receive hair donations and I won’t be able to shave my head until they can. 

However, considering the recent enforcements made to prevent virus spread, food aid is needed urgently and any donations, no matter the size, will be greatly appreciated by myself, The Trussell Trust and any person relying on food banks to stay safe and fed in this trying time. Even £2 can make a difference x

The Trussell Trust story:

 Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Shaving my head for The Trussell Trust

Description:
I am going to ride the distance of Lands End to John O'Groats (officially 876 miles, 1407kms) on an indoor bike starting on Saturday 11th April and will look to finish within the a week. I am raising money for the Trussell Trust who look after the UK food banks and at the moment families are in dire need of support. I hope you can donate as much as possible. 

You can join me on my ride on Zwift by following me. Just search for John McAvoy.

You can also donate via your mobile phone as follows:

Text JONNYMAC to 70450 to donate £5 - Texts cost £5 plus one standard rate message.

Or alternatively text:

“To donate £2 text JONNYMAC2 to 70450”

“To donate £10 text JONNYMAC10 to 70450”

“To donate £20 text JONNYMAC20 to 70450”
Title: John 's Zwifting from Lands End to John O'Groats

Description:
We’re both suckers for junk food and have decided to get healthier for a great cause!

From 1st May until 1st December 2020 we are giving up chocolate, biscuits, sweets and crisps! We don’t do anything by halves! 

Last year, Trussell Trust food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics and during the Covid 19 crisis, food banks are under even more pressure.

With your help, we can replenish some of the extra food that has been needed during this time as the Trussell Trust works towards ending the need for food banks all together. 

No one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Description:
After a mixture of wanting to take part in the charitable challenges, and also wanting to do something to help those less fortunate in these lockdown days days... I decided to set a challenge to some friends. There are several great efforts going on to raise money for the NHS charities, so I thought i’d go with something that is local to many of my friends and colleagues - this is the area right next to Dell Glasgow (remember that place!?)

Challenge is simple (but not easy!) & for the golfers out there, but anyone can try it!

Just like several similar challenges, the golfer needs to get 20 balls, place a bucket, basin or plant pot etc. 10 feet away. Film yourself hitting all 20 and for everyone you get in the bucket - donate (a minimum) of £2.00 to the just giving page below.

https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/carlo-cocozza

The idea is to get a lot of people taking part, so please post your video and nominate another garden golfer!

If you are tagged in this, you are nominated 😉 good luck!

Eg get 1 out of 20, donate £2 (or whatever you choose).
Get none in, donate at least £2 anyway. Every ‘ball in the bucket’ could be a meal for someone.

Description:
Action Hands is a community campaign launched during COVID19 by London Nursery Schools (LNS) founder Sara Brennan, Amanda Frolich and Alison Wheeler to support the well being of young children and families through music and play. 

With this song "Time To Shine", The Action Hands team is raising funds for the Trussell Trust to provide food for families in need during COVID19. 

Last year, Trussell Trust food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. The Trussell Trust aims to end the need for food banks. As a nation, The Trussell Trust believes no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Thank you for watching our video Time To Shine.  

https://youtu.be/LcEJ-2WptvM

It is a cause very close to our hearts and we hope you can show your support for this worthy cause.  The song will be available soon to purchase and download on all the regular digital platforms.  All profits from the downloads will also go to The Trussell Trust.  

Keep safe everyone!

With love

Action Hands   

(Sara/Amanda/Alison)

Description:
Feeding Families: Covid-19 Emergency Appeal

The ongoing lockdown is affecting us all, but for many families living in the slums of Kampala it has been devastating.

To meet this crisis, Kids Club Kampala - a small but ambitious and impactful charity, with a small team in the UK, and a team in Kampala employing local Ugandans - are running emergency food banks for vulnerable families to get them through this time.

They have already provided 982,107 emergency food packages, but need further help.

I have joined a collective challenge to run, skip and cycle the distance from here to Uganda along with a bigger team of about a dozen of us. We will be completing 1600 miles in total over a 10 week period. I have pledged to cover 200 miles by the end of August.

Each of us is aiming to raise £300 from our own networks and friends. We really appreciate any of your support especially during this uncertain time for everyone.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
