Description:
Save the UK's Charities

General fundraising has been hit very hard by the COVID-19 pandemic. Thousands of fundraising events have been cancelled and many charities, particularly smaller ones, are struggling to maintain services because of this huge reduction in income.

This impacts all sectors of society  from children to the elderly  as well as the vital work in areas such as palliative care, serious diseases, mental health, housing support, food supplies and countless others that charities support.
Title: Cavendish Road 2.6 challenge

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Everyone hates burpees. Fact. What began as a challenge between friends we hope can turn into something good that can raise funds for the Lewisham food bank who are doing amazing things to look after the most vulnerable in our local community.

So, we have set ourselves the challenge of doing 1,000 burpees (each) in a day. It won’t be easy but hopefully knowing we are making a difference to those who need it most during these tough times will get us through!

The Lewisham food bank is part of a network of over 400 food banks, working to tackle food poverty and hunger in our local community, as well as across the UK. They provide food to those in need - something of particular importance as we fight the current Coronavirus. 

We hope our efforts will help raise funds for the food bank and awareness of all the good they are doing within our local community. Any donations would be very much appreciated!

I'm going to be taking on the Everesting challenge on Zwift. It's simple - climb 8,848m or the equivalent of Everest in one ride. You are only allowed to use one climb, which you have to ride up and down repeatedly to make the height gain.

 Alpe du Zwift is 516m at its peak. I'm expecting to have to ride the segment 16 or 17 times, equating to about 200km in the saddle. Zwift allows you to freewheel downhill, so loo breaks can be taken while "descending". Other than that, it's going to be hard work and the threat of a pretty numb bum.
Title: Dan is Everesting Alpe Du Zwift!

Description:
Starting on Saturday 25th April, I’ll be running a marathon over 10 days averaging 2.62miles a day. To add a bit of humour, I will be RUNNING IN MY WEDDING DRESS! 😂 I’ll be doing this event to raise money for The Trussell Trust, who are working tirelessly to end hunger and poverty in UK. As a result of COVID they need our help more than ever right now. There are over 14 million people in the UK living in poverty, and 4.5 million are children.

We all need a bit of cheering up right now, and I thought the added comedy of running in my wedding dress would help put a smile on people's faces as I run past their homes. (I’ll obviously be strictly sticking to social distancing rules.)

Any donation to help this much needed cause would be hugely appreciated.
Title: Zehra's running a marathon (over 10 days) in her wedding dress

Description:
On the 20th May 2020 join the Great British Fast for Food Banks

Donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today!  


The national press have reported that, due to COVID-19, the number of people forced into hardship has increased.  Use of Food Banks has in some cases more than doubled. 

At the same time, due to the lockdown, donations have slowed.


We have to come together as a country and make sure support is there to protect people from food poverty during this emergency!


It also happens to be the month of Ramadan, when people of the Muslim faith refrain from eating and drinking from dawn to dusk.  Given the nature of the crisis, it seemed a fitting theme for this fundraising effort.


Please donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today, and if you can, on Wednesday the 20th May 2020, people of all faiths and those of no faith, try and fast in support of those in the UK and around the world who are having to go without.



Once you have donated, tag in at least 5 of your friends and get them to join you in making this a huge national effort.


What does a fast entail?  Well, traditionally, going without food or drink from sunrise to sunset (Google can tell you the times).  If that seems a bit much, simply sacrifice whatever you are comfortable with, even if that's just your second Double Decker from the tuck shop at elevenses.


Of course, you don't have to fast if you don't want to, or if you have a medical condition, are taking medication, are pregnant, or really just find it too daunting an ordeal, please do not fast, but still please make whatever donation you feel comfortable making.


However much we raise for Food Banks is better than nothing!


Let's try to get these hashtags trending on social media with stories about what you are giving up, how your fast was, ideas, thoughts, videos and good wishes - and let's just see what happens.

#GreatBritishFast

#fast4foodbanks 


If this is successful as a campaign, perhaps we can run it again, maybe even one day a month, for as long as the Trussell Trust is needed in the UK to prevent people from falling into such hardship.


With Grace, who knows what we might achieve together.


The below is a message from the Trussell Trust so you can see the incredible work they do and the challenges they are facing.

.......

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.  Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank.
As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: The Great British Fast

Title: Elizabeth's Keep on playing

Description:
While we're all stuck at home, I wanted to do something to put a smile on your face, and raise some money for the Trussell Trust. The national charity's network of food banks are expecting to see an increase in need over the coming weeks as the coronavirus pandemic unfolds.

To help, and hopefully(!) brighten up your day, I am dedicating my mornings to video call as many of you who donate as possible. All you need to do is donate to the Trussell Trust on this page, ensure your phone number is included in your donation, and tick that you are happy to receive further communications so that I am allowed to call you!

By donating, not only will you be in for the chance of a receiving a video call from me, but you will also help people struggling as a result of the coronavirus pandemic. 

Food banks were already seeing an increased need before this outbreak but it's likely that more people than ever will be unable to afford their own food over the coming weeks, especially people who have unstable jobs or who aren't eligible for sick pay, and will need to turn to a food bank for support. 

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust’s network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over half a million of these of these going to children. 

Your donations will help the Trussell Trust support food banks in their network and ensure people in crisis can access emergency food during this challenging time. This money could help fund vans to help food banks deliver food to people's homes, buy food (if necessary and available!), recruit additional staff to meet the demand, but also, vitally, campaign for change so that everyone can afford their own food. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and I look forward to chatting to a few of you over the coming days.

NOW FOR THE LEGAL PART: 

All funds raised will go directly to the Trussell Trust. You can find out more about the organisation on their website www.trusselltrust.org. 

I will try to call as many of you as possible but it might not be possible to speak to everyone who donates. 

Please note that I can only contact you if you provide a phone number and ‘opt in’ to share their details with the Trussell Trust. 

The Trussell Trust is committed to protecting your privacy and will process any personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Act 2018. Your details will be kept safe and secure, only used by the Trussell Trust or those who work for us and will not be shared, sold or rented to third parties for marketing purposes. In this instance, your details (first name, phone number and amount donated), will be shared with Michael McIntyre for the purposes of this fundraising event only.

We may use information you provide for analysis, research or screening purposes in order to help us understand our supporters so that we can save resources and deliver the best possible service.
Title: Michael McIntyre is supporting the Trussell Trust

Description:
On the 20th May 2020 join the Great British Fast for Food Banks
Donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today!  


The national press have reported that, due to COVID-19, the number of people forced into hardship has increased.  Use of Food Banks has in some cases more than doubled. 
At the same time, due to the lockdown, donations have slowed.

We have to come together as a country and make sure support is there to protect people from food poverty during this emergency!

It also happens to be the month of Ramadan, when people of the Muslim faith refrain from eating and drinking from dawn to dusk.  Given the nature of the crisis, it seemed a fitting theme for this fundraising effort.

Please donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today, and if you can, on Wednesday the 20th May 2020, people of all faiths and those of no faith, try and fast in support of those in the UK and around the world who are having to go without.


Once you have donated, tag in at least 5 of your friends and get them to join you in making this a huge national effort.


What does a fast entail?  Well, traditionally, going without food or drink from sunrise to sunset (Google can tell you the times).  If that seems a bit much, simply sacrifice whatever you are comfortable with, even if that's just your second Double Decker from the tuck shop at elevenses.

Of course, you don't have to fast if you don't want to, or if you have a medical condition, are taking medication, are pregnant, or really just find it too daunting an ordeal, please do not fast, but still please make whatever donation you feel comfortable making.

However much we raise for Food Banks is better than nothing!

Let's try to get these hashtags trending on social media with stories about what you are giving up, how your fast was, ideas, thoughts, videos and good wishes - and let's just see what happens.
#GreatBritishFast
#fast4foodbanks 

If this is successful as a campaign, perhaps we can run it again, maybe even one day a month, for as long as the Trussell Trust is needed in the UK to prevent people from falling into such hardship.


With Grace, who knows what we might achieve together.

The below is a message from the Trussell Trust so you can see the incredible work they do and the challenges they are facing.
.......
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.  Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank.
As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: The Great British Fast

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Description: Galvanised by the belief that being clean is not a luxury or a privilege, The Hygiene Bank is a registered, people powered, grassroots charity grounded in community. We collect and re-distribute donated toiletries, hygiene, beauty and personal care items to UK charities, voluntary organisations and schools. These in turn are then given for free to their beneficiaries. Our passion stems from a sense of injustice: it's not right that anyone should face hygiene poverty in modern Britain.
Title: Hygiene Help

Description:
Thank you for taking time to visit our page.

We have partnered with the charity First Love Foundation, who are not just a food bank, their goal is to listen, support and find solutions to get peoples 'lives back on track'. 

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. 

Thank you for your support!
Title: Supporting FoodBank

Description:
Please join me on the Boxing Day 2019 from Midday for my charity stream to help raise as much money as we can for such an amazing cause.

You can find me at www.twitch.tv/nelinde

If you can't make a donation fear not! You can help by spreading the word and sharing this JustGiving page on social media and with friends and family.


No one should go hungry, especially at Xmas! 

Yet thousands of families are going without food due to poverty, parents going without so their children don't have empty bellies.

This is 2019! This shouldn't even be a thing... Sadly so many people in the UK are in this dire situation. It could be a neighbour or even a family member!

UK Food Banks are vastly overstretched and are in need of food donations more than ever before to meet the highest demands ever to be recorded since the Trussell Trust started in 1999!


But you can help spread a little Xmas cheer <3 


Please spare what you can afford, as little as £2 can afford a single meal!

You can also help by donating any spare "long shelf life" foods such as tinned vegetables etc to your local Food Bank or supermarket Food Bank collection box <3

Having personally relied on my local Food Bank in previous times of hardship I have first hand experience of the effect and contribution Food Banks have on so many people facing financial hardship and not being able to afford food for their families or themselves. They provide a light in times of darkness, often providing much more than just food. 

They offer an ear to listen, a personal connection where there is nothing but loneliness. Many Food Banks even provide clothing that they've had donated. My local Food Bank even run a free playgroup where parents can go to meet other parents and make friendships.

I can't stress how much a small donation can help <3






Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Title: 100km in a Day Cycle Challenge

Description:
On the 25th April this year I was supposed to travel over to the Highlands and run the Highland fling 54mile ultra marathon with a few mates.  Covid-19 has put a stop to that and confined us all to our homes.  I’ve found that hard but it strikes me that many people have it far worse!  Food banks are sadly going to be vital for many in the coming weeks and months so I have decided to still do the 54 miles, in my garden (1080 laps) to raise money for my local food bank charity.  If you are able to donate, I’d be really grateful.  Below you’ll find some info about my chosen charity.

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us especially at these unprecedented times.  With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Dan's Rock Hill Garden Ultra page

Description:
I set this page up for last year's marathon but it was then cancelled and this year's one moved to October. 

Before Christmas 2020 I read a lot about food banks in the UK and found it quite shocking. Not a lot has changed now and so I want to try to raise some more money. There are more people using them than ever in many parts of the country, and the Trussell Trust support a nationwide network of over 1200 food banks. They provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

Between April 2019 and March 2020, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided a record 1.9 million food supplies to people in crisis, an 18% increase on the previous year and during the coronavirus pandemic food banks have seen need rise even further.

I know I have run the marathon before, and I know I have asked for donations before. But this seems like a really worthy cause and an issue that worries me a lot so I hope people will find a few spare quid to donate. I will definitely top up the final total myself too as I feel in a very fortunate to be running the London Marathon and want to complete the race knowing it has also done some good. 

If you are a UK taxpayers and want to sponsor me please tick the Gift Aid box. This enables them to claim an extra 25p per £1 you donate at no extra cost to you. A £10 donation will be transformed into £12.50 and makes a huge difference so please do so. 

Many thanks 

Jeffers

Description:
The people of Beirut desperately need emergency aid after an explosion devastated Lebanons capital.

£20 - Provide 1 Emergency Family Food Pack

£100 - Provides 5 Emergency Family Food Packs

£200 - Provides 10 Emergency Family Food Packs

Support the Vulnerable

An explosion in warehouses storing 2,750 tonnes of ammonium nitrate ripped through Beiruts port on 4th August 2020. More than 150 people died, 5,000 were injured and 300,000 left homeless. With the economy already in dire straits and people struggling in the coronavirus pandemic, the disaster has led to a new humanitarian crisis. With your support, Islamic Help aims to assist the most vulnerable by providing desperately-needed food, water and PPE.

Their Time of Need

The damage to Beiruts port from the explosion disrupted food imports and supplies at a time when the countrys economy is already on its knees. The health system was also severely affected with at least three hospitals put out of action. By providing emergency

Description:
While I was off work on furlough, I wanted to do something positive. I am in no way a runner and have never enjoyed it even at school. But with help, support and guidance from my friend, I started the Couch 2 5k. I’m still currently working through the runs and weirdly enjoying them. 

I thought I would set myself a goal and signed up for a 5K run. Best bit about the run is that it involves gin! 

I wanted to help raise money for a charity as well and have chosen Combat Stress. Here is what they do:

WE ARE COMBAT STRESS, THE UK'S LEADING CHARITY FOR VETERANS' MENTAL HEALTH

For over a century we’ve been helping former servicemen and women deal with issues like post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), anxiety and depression. Today we provide specialist treatment and support for veterans from every service and conflict, focusing on those with complex mental health issues.

Title: Lebanon Emergency Appeal - Food Packs

Description:
A donation made to the Deutsche Bank UK - Beirut Emergency Appeal will go to the British Red Cross and be restricted to their provision of vital aid in Beirut. 

For all permanent employees, please forward your donation receipt to PlusYou.csrUK@db.com to enable your donation to be matched. 

This will come from your individual annual Matched Giving allowance. Employees do not need to claim this matching, the UK CSR team will process this for you.

The enormous explosion that leveled parts of Beirut, Lebanon, on Tuesday, August 4, killed at least 137 people and injured more than 4,000 others, overwhelming the authorities and damaging many hospitals and critical facilities.

With an already weak health system struggling to cope with the coronavirus pandemic, hospitals in Beirut are now overwhelmed
in the wake of the massive explosion. 

The British Red Cross is working closely with the Lebanese Red Cross, which has been at the heart of the response. The immediate focus is on saving lives. 

The money raised will help the relief work on the ground being provided by the Lebanese Red Cross, which is responding to this emergency. In the unlikely event that the British Red Cross raises more money than can be reasonably and efficiently spent in Lebanon, any surplus funds will be used to help them prepare for and respond to other disasters / emergencies worldwide.

Title: Joobs' Footsteps for Food

Description:
The Challenge: Dave will be travelling from the top of Slieve Donard home to the doorstep in Belfast on foot (mostly walking, some running, probably some crawling too).

The Cause: To raise enough money to cover one month’s food for Little Hearts Orphanage (Chennai, India) – approximately £1200.

The Date: Bank Holiday Monday 31st August. 

The Route: Setting out at 9am from Bloody Bridge, over Slieve Donard and down the Glen River valley into Newcastle, before heading home via Dundrum, Clough, Ballynahinch and Carryduff – approximately 34 miles in total.

The Target: Aiming for under ten hours in time -but raising at least £1200 is far more important!

The Detail: One of the daily meals at Little Hearts’ is usually supplied by a local university, but because of COVID 19, the university has been closed and meals are not currently being provided. Food is also paid for by local contributors, however the orphanage has been under lockdown because so many of the children and young people there have major health conditions and physical needs, and so contributions have fallen. 

There is now a huge need to assist Little Hearts to provide enough food for the orphanage during the pandemic.
Title: Donard to Doorstep Challenge

Description:
I’m hoping to raise £2500 for poor families in Afghanistan.
My method to raise money will be by providing students with live-streams, where I, and a professional (such as a corporate lawyer), will discuss important things that will help students in their upcoming applications and interviews. Even if you aren't a student, but would like to support this cause, thank you so much. To get more information, please watch my 3-minute video: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FQ1FwHE_fMQ&t=7s

The money raised will focus on helping the most vulnerable of the vulnerable. For example, it'll provide food packages for orphans, the disabled, and widows. These groups have been disproportionately affected by the 40-year war, and the COVID-19 crisis in Afghanistan, and they need your support. 

If you are a student, please consider donating the cost of a cup of coffee (or more if you can) to my fundraising page. 100% will be donated directly to the people who need it. Below, there will be some information explaining how much money is needed to actually feed a family, please do check it out to get a better understanding of the goal.

This cause has no racial preference, it has no hidden goal, and it has no political agenda. There is a time and place for politics. Right now, people require your support since it’s a life or death situation, and with your money, we can choose life. 

£50 can sustain an entire family with the following for a month:

1) Wheat flour (50kg)
2) Rice (24kg)
3) Cooking oil (5L)
4) Green tea (1kg)
5) Sugar (3.5kg)
6) Beans (3kg)
7) Soap (6xbars)

Please, donate the cost of a cup of coffee (or more if you can), to help save lives.
Title: Ali Obeid is raising 2000 pounds to help provide poor Afghans with essential food packs during the COVID-19 pandemic

Description: Across the world, the coronavirus pandemic has created unprecedented challenges, words like lockdown, hand-hygiene and self-isolation have entered our vocabulary. Although the problems faced are the same, the ability of countries to respond effectively are vastly different:Isolation is impossible in overcrowded slum communities, hand-hygiene is meaningless without running water, or if you can’t afford soap. And if you survive on income from daily labour, lockdown quickly means starvation.Global Care has made a huge difference. They are using their Children At Risk fund in this crisis. Here are examples of how the money is spent:In Uganda, a food parcel feeding a family of 8 for a month costs around £40. In India’s  Patripul slum, near Mumbai a care package for a family of 4, costs £61. In Bangladesh, a food parcel including soap and face masks costs £24. We have never faced a crisis like this, simultaneously affecting so many of our projects. We want to raise at least £100,000 to see us through 2020.
Title: Heather's Slum Supper Challenge

Description:
Hi! My name is Alice and I am a coward. I don't like frights and I don't like zombies. I also don't like food insecurity and families going hungry.

The cost of food is rising, whilst the availability is dropping. When combined with the financial pressures of the pandemic, this has resulted in skyrocketing numbers of people in the UK using and relying on foodbanks and charities as their primary food source.

That's why I want to raise money for FareShare - a charity that combats food wastage AND food poverty by redistributing surplus foods, which are then turned in to delicious meals for those who need it most.

Please join me whilst I play/scream/hide through The Last of Us 2, Sunday evenings from 7.30pm-9.30pm on Twitch.

ALSO, I will be donating £1 every time I pause the game due to fear!
Title: Alice's Fear4Food: 'The Last of Us 2' Live Stream Gaming

Description:
Llamau believe that nobody should live in fear of becoming homeless. Our mission is to end homelessness for young people, women, and families in Wales.

Unfortunaltely for thousands of people in Wales, homelessness is a frightening reality. For many people we support, home is not a safe place to be.

That's why we're asking you to take part in Sleep Over; spend one night sleeping in your living room, garden, or in a den, and raise funds to make a world without homelessness a reality.
Title: Lloyds Banking Group Tredegar Park Newport

Description:
Assalaamu Alaykom - May the warmest Islamic greetings of peace be upon you


Me and some childhood friends have decided to try earn some ajr in sha Allah by doing a marathon from Cheam to Marble Arch and the whole way back. BY FOOT.  - 26.2 miles.  

This is to raise money for Yemen, with Islamic Relief a charity dedicated to providing Yemenis relief from the destitution and suffering occurring in their country.

More than 5 years of conflict has deepened Yemen’s poverty, devastated its infrastructure, and caused widespread hunger and suffering and this disease is a second front that Yemen is unprepared for.


24 million people are in need of humanitarian aid.

Families and communities have been torn apart and left without even the most basic of living essentials: 

  • 19.7 million people need basic healthcare
  • 18 million people are in need of water and sanitation facilities 
  • 3+ million people have been left displaced by conflict

With your support we can help these communities in their hour of need.Donate Now and help save lives. (Islamic Relief)

Donate Now

  • £25 can provide essential hygiene kits to a displaced family
  • £80 could feed a family for one month
  • £100 could provide enough basic PPE for one frontline health worker for four months
Title: Zuhair's Cheam to Central Marathon for Yemen Relief

Title: Elizabeth's page

Description: Last year, Trussell Trust food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChangeWe are raising money by walking as many miles as we can in September.  We have set ourselves the challenge of walking the 150 mile length of the London Outer Orbital Path (the LOOP) as many times as we can over September.  We are counting every step we take (with fitbits), and adding them onto our total each day. One circuit of the LOOP is 300,000 steps. We will do this once each... but can we do it three times? who will step the most, Amy or Aoife? follow our updates to find out!
Title: Amy and Aoife's Step up September page

Description:
During the August bank holiday weekend, the team at Dodge Radio will be raising money for Richard House Children's Hospice. A cause very close to us.

We will be running a special schedule of shows, as well as plenty ways for you to get involved including a raffle and much, much more. You can find out more about the station and our schedule over at www.dodgeradio.net

Also keep an eye on our social media to see what we get up to!

www.facebook.com/dodgeradio

www.twitter.com/dodgeradio

www.instagram.com/dodgeradio_live

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHY RICHARD HOUSE?

Richard House Children's Hospice serves the heart of East London. They deliver specialist care for babies, children and young adults, while supporting their families through counselling, therapy, bereavement support and more. 

With a focus on living for today and creating positive memories for tomorrow, they also offer a range of activities for all the family to enjoy. Their services are completely free of charge and as a local charity over 70% of their funding is from the generosity of local people, companies and groups.

WHAT RICHARD HOUSE SAY:

“The last few months haven't been easy for Richard House. The global pandemic forced the team to make decisions we never imagined we would face – decisions that impact the lives of hundreds of sick children and their families. But during all this we have been able to be here for our families, offering them support and assistance. We foresee an unprecedented drop in income over the next 6-12 months as a result of the cancellation of fundraising events, activities and the closure of our six charity shops. 

Out of 191 events in 2020, 67% have either been cancelled or postponed. These include our 20th Birthday Thames Cruise and Summer Fair, Prudential Ride London, Royal Parks Half, Orbit Abseil, Hackney Half and all 8 Action Challenge extreme events. The loss of income from these events alone, is in excess of £150,000. Despite all the incredible work we have achieved so far, Richard House still faces an uncertain future where we may need to cut services and we may even need to close our doors for good. This would be devastating for our families at a time when they need us most.

It's only thanks to our loyal supporters, that we stand a chance of stopping this uncertain future. We're relying on the momentum from our community continuing in order for us to continue giving care throughout this crisis.”

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Your donations can help bring smiles to those who need it the most! Make a difference, play your part to support this charity who do incredible work in our community!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

TO ENTER THE RAFFLE:

Raffle tickets cost £1 per entry. 100% of all donations are sent to Richard House Children’s Hospice.

Step 1 - Visit our JustGiving page (www.justgiving.com/fundraising/dodgeradio) and ‘Donate’ the value for your desired number of tickets (i.e. £10 for 10 entries)

Step 2 - When completing your online donation, clearly state in the message box On Justgiving the value given for raffle tickets (i.e. Raffle £10). Please provide contact details so we can inform you of your raffle numbers. 

Step 3 - Text Dodge Radio on 07520633996 to inform us of your raffle ticket(s) purchase. 

Start your message with the word 'RAFFLE' to inform us of your JustGiving page donation to be included in the raffle. All JustGiving donations will be checked before raffle ticket numbers are issued. By entering the Dodge Radio raffle you agree with Dodge Radio Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy at www.dodgeradio.net.

Important: texting Dodge Radio AND NOT donating WILL NOT enter you into the raffle. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

RAFFLE PRIZES 

Cookie Gift Box 

Echo Falls Red Wine 

Echo Falls White Wine 

Farm Foods Gift Voucher 

£25 Hobgoblin Music Gift Voucher 

Hoebridge Golf Centre Family Voucher

Vegan Friendly Candles 

Candle, soap and Scrub gift set 

Gift Basket x 2. Gift baskets contain 2 Lilly Melts Lemon Lime and 1 Loofah, Bath Pearl. 

TicTacToe Board Game 

Friendship Bracelets

Little magic photo frame 

Football shaped money boxes

An assortment of books including; The Accidental Apprentice by Vikas Swarup, F.r.i.e.n.d.s. by David Wild, The Interpretation of Murder by Jed Rubenfeld and Change Your Life with NLP by Lindsey Agness 

GOOD LUCK AND THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING RICHARD HOUSE!

Description:
Why is this important? 

Our ecosystems are failing because of the way we are consuming, Our Wildlife is in critical danger of becoming extinct. The Jersey local food week and Durrell's missions are so similar because, It's all for the benefit of our natural world. 

Every choice you make about what you eat, makes a difference to not only your body, but your local environment, the wider world, and the future way we grow, produce, and eat. 

So if your interested in connecting more with your local land, uping your health, supporting Durrell's conservation effort, and massively supporting the environment, please say going on the FB event page, and start sharing your local food recipes and encourage friends and family to support you by sponsoring you and donating here! 


Ways to take part on the local week are -

1) SWAP - one non local item to local

2) ONE MEAL - a day mostly local

3) FULLY - local for the week, with one trade item.

4) ORANIC - fully local for the week with one organic trade item


Durrell Wildlife Conservation Trust is an international charity working to save species from extinction. Established by author and conservationist, Gerald Durrell, in 1959, Durrell’s overall aim is for more diverse, beautiful and resilient natural landscapes in which species can thrive and people can enjoy a deeper connection with nature. This approach concentrates on the most threatened wildlife in the most threatened places.
Title: The Jersey Local Food Challenge fundraiser for Durrell

CharityName: World Food Programme - Prism the Gift Fund
Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I've decided to take my first week of summer leave to jog a full marathon over the course of 7 days from 15 - 21 August. I am undertaking this challenge to benefit the victims of the explosion in Beirut.

On August 4, the city of Beirut was brought crashing down by an explosion in the port which has cut off 90% of the city's food supplies and medical aid. Already crippled by food shortages, an economic crisis and the Covid-19 Pandemic, the city is in need of DIRECT aid.

After researching several sources, I chose The World Food Programme which is escalating its efforts in Lebanon to bring food to the people at risk of hunger - now a majority of the population.

You can read more about what they are doing here : https://insight.wfp.org/world-food-programme-to-scale-up-in-lebanon-as-blast-destroys-beiruts-port-7270471d1f87

Thank you to everyone for helping this cause. Feel free to choose another charity with direct resources in the area and comment on the page if you prefer to help another way.
Title: Not-a-Netflix Marathon for Beirut

Title: Alison’s page

Description:
I have challenged myself to take up running again during August (I am now 62 and it's 11 years since I ran regularly) and then to complete Ten 6 mile Runs during September. 6 miles (9,600 metres) is the distance along the coast from my home to Mousehole Harbour and back again.

Why am I doing it?

Not being able to buy your next days food seems unthinkable for most of us but its actually happening in hundreds of households here in the far west of Cornwall. Imagine, yesterday you found out that your work had stopped, today you get a sinking feeling when you discover that you don't qualify for unemployment benefit and you haven't met the criteria for a business grant. You've enough money to last three or four days - then what. Young mums become malnourished because they are giving the food they have to their children. The children's shoes have worn through, but they'll have to wait, and today the washing machine broke down. Parents have had their self-esteem knocked out of them, they harbor thoughts of inadequacy and desperation. They turn to sources of credit with no means of making repayments. Tensions in some households are at breaking point. 

Our money can relieve food-poverty, reduce anxiety and prevent domestic breakdowns.

One recent letter of thanks said . . .

“Thank you so much for your donation, it had a massive impact. £500 of the £1000 went to a family who were already vulnerable and in hardship when one parent passed away, the remaining parent unknown to us was selling items from her house on Facebook just to pay for the funeral and both her and our Head teacher ended up in tears when she took her the cheque and heard how hard it has been for them financially.”

“The Rotary Club have had a huge impact with their donation and the families who received help were so grateful.”

Please give as generously as you can.
Title: 'Miles of Hope' - relieving food-poverty and hardship in the far southwest.

Title: Secure Trust Bank - Commercial Finance - Go The Extra Mile

Description:
This September Occupational Therapist Traci-Ann (that's me!) and Physiotherapist Rachael (that's my work buddy!) will be donning trainers and co-ordinating blue and green sweatbands to complete a virtual🚶🏻‍♀️🚶🏻‍♀️along an iconic British route, Hadrian's Wall, to raise 💷💷💷 for the Trussell Trust.

Here's why:

During April 2020, The Trussell Trust saw a 89% increase in food bank use compared to the same period last year, with a staggering 107% increase in emergency food parcels for children. This shouldn't be happening in 2020.

Hunger isn‘t just about food. It’s about not having enough money for the essentials. No one should be forced to use a food bank to get by. Lets see a UK without the need for food banks, where everyone has enough money to afford the basics and put a stop to poverty.

If you can donate any amount to this great cause that would be very much appreciated. 😊 If you are unable to donate then please share my page on your own social media to spread the word! 😀
Title: Traci-Ann's page

Description:
80% of the Yemeni population are in urgent need of humanitarian aid.The UN estimates that 130 children under the age of 5 die each day from hunger and disease in YemenOUR AIM:We want to give 300 families food packs that will sustain them for a month. For that we need 300 people to give £85 to support a family for a month!Raise the money amoungst your friends and family and call into our online appeal on the 24th of July - Streamed live on facebook and youtube. We will announce your results live on screen!Choose your target:£85 - One Family Food Pack£170 - Two Family Food Pack£255 - Three Family Food Pack£425 - Four Family Food Pack£850 - Ten Family Food Pack

Charity is always something that has always had a deep connection with me and by taking part in numerous charity events in the past has really driven my enthusiasm to think of new and creative ways of fundraising money. 

Now have started my new cooking and baking interest I thought what’s more of a better way,  than to actually share my talent by giving away some baked treats through a raffle prize in return to raise money for an emergency campaign which is very important to me. So there’s absolutely no loss in the raffle.
Title: Yemen Food Pack Challenge

Description:
Millions of children in the UK are born into child poverty, which impacts them in their early years but also harms their life chances for their entire lifespan. Baby Bank recycles used items like cots, prams and clothing, and raises money for non-reusable items like nappies and toiletries to help families going through challenges like mental health problems, homelessness, being refugees, fleeing domestic violence. 

As a paediatrician I know how much poverty impacts a child's physical and mental health, and development for the future. I have loved volunteering for this charity since living in Bristol. 

Tomorrow will be my 32nd birthday and I'd love to raise £368 for Baby Bank (to help each family costs roughly £46 so this would help 8 families!!) I only need 5 more people to donate £3.20 in order to reach this goal.  

Thankyou so much for your donation.
Title: Emma is turning 32!

Description:
Assalamu alaykum warahmatullahi wabarakatuh 

I am raising money to support Global Rahmah Foundation's Lebanon disaster appeal to help the victims of the devastating explosion in Beirut that has claimed the lives of hundreds and injured thousands. GRF has already a team on the ground now providing assistance to those affected. 

We have all seen the videos emerging from Beirut. When I saw that second blast go off it shook me to the core. I never felt helpless like I have felt at that moment. I just cannot imagine how our brothers and sisters are existing right now. The fear, the shock, the loss, the sadness, the uncertainty. Alhamdulillah for everything. 

We cannot do much for our brothers and sisters right now except pray for them and send as much as fund we can to them. What they need now is our support. Please donate generously so GRF can provide emergency accommodation to those that have lost their homes, emergency medical treatment to the injured and food parcels to families affected by the tragedy.

Please share this link with all your friends and family so we can help as many people as possible.

JazakAllah Khair.
Title: Najma's Lebanon Emergency Food Parcels Collection

Description:
Let's Stand Together,

Barakah Aid, Farah Saeed Trust and Abbas Foundation Trust have collaborated together to help provide food aid via Syria Relief.

On the 5th August 2020, 

A bomb have killed 100 people and injured thousands. Hospitals. Homes. Businesses. Cafes and many jobs have all been affected. More than 250,000 people are left homeless. 

This is at the time where Lebanon is under a huge economic crisis and the coronavirus pandemic.

Syria is one of the many charities working in Lebanon who helped Syrian refugees. However they are know extending their humanitarian aid to help the victims of the blast.

£100 for emergency food and kits for the victims.

www.justgiving.com/standtogetherfoodaidappeal
Title: The Farah's STAND TOGETHER FOOD AID APPEAL

Description:
On August 4th 2020, A huge explosion ripped through the port of the Lebanese capital Beirut. So far over 100 people have been confirmed killed and around 5,000 wounded; the mayor of Beirut has claimed that as many as 300,000 have been made homeless.


The funds raised will go towards emergency food supplies & medical kits. The people of Lebanon need our help, lets heed their call


Please donate generously and share!


The Messenger said, “…the dearest of deeds to Allah, may He be exalted, is joy that you bring to a Muslim, or relieving him of distress, or paying off debt for him, or dispelling his hunger. And to walk with a brother to meet his needs is dearer to me than observing i‘tikaaf in this mosque – meaning the mosque of Madinah – for a month.
Title: Nasirodiin's Lebanon Emergency Appeal

Description:
I'm taking part in ActionAid's Food For Thought! You are invited to my virtual dinner party to support women and girls living in the poorest communities around the world.  

ActionAid is an international charity that works with women and girls living in poverty. Their dedicated local staff are ending violence and fighting poverty so that all women, everywhere can create the future they want. If you would like to find out more about the amazing work they do, you can find out more at www.actionaid.org.uk 

Will you attend my virtual dinner? Simply donate to RSVP! I cannot wait to catch up with you all and cook some delicious food.

Together, we are changing the world with women and girls.
Title: Food for Thought
